Rooms were very clean. Wide range of channels offered on the cable TV. Strong Wi-Fi signal. Friendly house keeping staff. Water pressure for the shower is a little weak. Might have a required water regulator in it. Fridge and microwave worked great. Beds were comfy.

The only problem I had with  this hotel was location of room. Located on second floor (elevator provided) with an extremely long outside walkway ( 12 doors down). Shower chair provided for use in tub. Hand held shower head provided.

Thanks to everyone who made our stay great. We will definitely be back! Housekeeping was amazing, we had a small maintenance concern and it was taken care of promptly. Great people at the front desk and quality service!

I was told that I needed to pay more money for an upgrade.  Be sure to clarify should you find yourself in the same position.  They went as far as to tell me that I would have to check out immediately and find somewhere else to stay if I did not pay.

We had to unclog our own toilet and sink! The guy at the front desk did reassure me that the plungers were brand new. (Said with sarcasm). Housekeeping staff were really nice! But the girl who checked us in didn't know anything about guests being able to use the mobile check-in Wyndham app offers. And the guy at the front desk didn't even know their own wifi password and had to call me back.

The hotel is pretty basic.  If you just need a bed to sleep and a bathroom to shower in, this is your place.  But the basic things that are supposed to be standard in the room didnt work properly.  The AC made the room smell like Pee and mildew when the compressor would shut off and the fan would just be blowing.   The TV color was off and the settings were unable to be changed because the remote only controled the sattelite box. There was a line going right through the middle of the screen.  It was definitely the TV because no matter what channel I was watching it was right there.  Also the fridge in the room wasn't cold enough.  I figured when i got there I would buy a few frozen things to pop in the microwave, by the next day everything was thawed out and nasty.

Decided to listen to the positive reviews and booked for a night. We got there and found the bed sheets stained. There was stains on the white towels in the bathroom. And I found a hair ball folded up in one of the towels. The bed sheets were thin and ripped. The walls were stained. During covid this is not something you’d like to see on a trip. Only booked because of closeness to Downtown Disney. Would not book again. Just happy the workers were nice and didn’t make things more difficult.

I booked this stay because the location is good and convenient but the management treats people like garbage. Do no stay here   “Nick” is disrespectful, takes personal phone calls instead of speaking with you. If you call him he will hang up on you if you have any questions, and will not tell you his full/real name.   He called me dumb for not checking my reservation type, and said the cheap price is the reason you get service like this.   I called corporate and they said they have no control over reporting resort staff. I told them they should change that policy, because he’s taking advantage of their system and the guests.

I made a reservation on 1/11 and my credit card was charged. I received a confirmation e-mail also. My wife and I arrive to check in only to find the hotel was closed.  The manager from a neighboring hotel and a security guard confirmed this. Now we are sitting in the parking lot trying to find another hotel. I will never stay in another Wyndham hotel and will tell everyone I know about this experience.

My wife and I enjoy our stay at this hotel in February, but there was some confusion:  the front desk person insisted that they had no pool on their grounds (in spite of what this site and Expedia say).  Expedia was no less adamant that they had one.  We did not see the pool while we were there, so the whole thing chocks up to an odd situation.

The room we stayed in was very clean and spacious, and the staff was very friendly and made the check-in and check-out process very simple and quick. Beware though, if you intent to use a card to pay for your stay make sure your credit/ debit card had a chip. My card did not, so I had to use an alternate form of payment which was a bit inconvenient. Breakfast was good, nothing special. The options were simple like oatmeal, toast, yogurt etc. The location is great, and the Uber to Disney was only $7! I would definitely plan to stay here again.

Our room was recently remodeled, very spacious and quiet. The location is great, close to so many stores and freeways. The breakfast was nothing much, bread, oatmeal, danish, and cereal. I would definitely stay here again if I needed a room near this location. Very clean too.

Overall it is good for the price. The location is quiet and close to where we needed to be. Breakfast was lacklustre amd not worth going down for. I would stay there again if we had to. Not horrible for the price we paid!

I have never had such bad back pain after a hotel stay. I didn't have much of a choice for where I could stay in Anaheim due to cost. So I chose this Days Inn. Needless to say I didn't sleep well most nights. You can hear every foot step of your upstairs neighbors as well as a drafty window that lets in all of the street noise. If you want a place to actually sleep at night I do not recommend this facility.

The staff was friendly. the room were fresh clean, but the water in the shower so weak and slow flow. The mattress and pillows are lumpy  were uncomfortable ,The breakfast offered could use a little more variety, And why we have prepaid $100 deposit? Other Hotel did not have to prepaid.

Very friendly staff in this updated and clean hotel.  Convenient location, continental breakfast, good parking.  Bathroom was updated and very clean. Toiletries and even toilet paper were higher quality than expected.   Bed was very comfortable and room was quiet despite being close to a busy road.

Excellent. Staff was very polite & helpful. Accommodations were wonderful. Extremely satisfied. The only issues were: had to ask 2x for a tub stopper; we reported our interior lock was not working (lock offset), but front desk stated we didn't know how to use it; noisy upstairs neighbors; & they lack the favorite true crime networks (ID, Oxygen, TruTV, etc...). We'll definitely return.

You can still fill up on the selection they had, and this kept us going till dinner time, no need for lunch.  The only downside was there was no safe in the room!

I can’t sleep because all I hear are the cars right outside the window that apparently has no soundproofing at all. There also is a fly that keeps on attacking the light from my screen as I write this. Must be mad I killed its brother earlier when we first got here. I know this room is cheaper than mostly anything else in the area, but I have to write this anyhow since Expedia said this place was in the 4 star range, hence my family staying here instead of the more expensive places that cover this area. First of all, the parking lot is shared with another little motel. Not many people here tonight so plenty of space, but the pool is also shared by this other motel. There is no spa and the pool is not heated at all, so don’t head down there in March even though it is 80 during

Summary Heading: Only if really need a room in Disneyland area
Summary: Clean room, filthy bathroom. They had upgraded the room (nice mattress) but the tub and shower were a joke. Water faucet wouldn't work and tub was filled with white scuz (probably residue from an old rag).
It was just, okay...nice people, good locale for conference at Wolf Lodge next day. Strange breakfast set up. Styrofoam coffee cups were like shot glasses!

Summary Heading: I tried to make a reservation 4 next year. The price doubled.  This company lost my yearly business.
Summary: Instead of welcoming a regular customer. They fouled the price of the room.  I originally pd. $80 a night for 3 nights.  I willl never stay their no Recommened it

Yes, I realize this may not look as fancy outside as some of the places down the street - but thats just the point.  Those other places were charging nearly twice the nightly rate, were just a block or so away, and the rooms in this place were GREAT.  The staff was great, the location was great, and the I wish I could give a negative rating just to keep this one hidden for myself.  And no....I do not work for them nor do I have any relationship to this place in any way other than having stayed there just recently on the way back from a cruise in Long Beach.

Most hotels offer a cancellation period.  I tried to cancel one of my two rooms 20+ days in advance.  Not possible.  STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!!   Customer service is off the charts bad.  They don't return calls, and are rude and inconsiderate.  STAY ANYWHERE ELSE!!!!
Manager Response: We apologize that you don't agree with the cancellation period provided to you by booking.com. Unfortunately, when you book with third party sites you agree to there terms and policies. Since you reserved an advance discounted purchase rate booking you waived the right to a cancellation period. We hope you will try booking with the hotel directly next time which gives you a flexibility of canceling 24 hours prior to arrival. Thank you.

Summary: Place was clean, staff was friendly, and the continental breakfast was decent. Be aware, though, that there is an extra charge for early check in, so I had to wait 20 minutes before I could check in...a little inconvenient as I'd been driving for 7 hours :) Also, if you use a debit card, there will be a $100 deposit to be placed on the room and, depending on your bank, can take up to 4 weeks to get back to you.

Summary Heading: Rasonable price, comfortable, quiet, convenient... everything I look for in a hotel stay
Summary: My title says it all.Though not very grand when you drive up, my king room was spotless, modern, comfortable and much much quieter than my room at the Hyatt Regency Orange County down the street where I stayed for two nights as part of the same conference. The free breakfast is nothing to write home about, but cereal, fruit, really excellent coffee, yogurt and juice along with bread for toasting - more than my typical breakfast at home. There is a shopping center across the street with a grocery store and several inexpensive dining options, and Uber is always super fast at this location. I would happily stay there again if I had another conference nearby.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your stay with us. We are happy to know that you enjoyed our breakfast and found our rooms to very clean, I will share this with our Housekeeping staff. We look forward to you staying with us again in the near future. Thank you.

Summary Heading: STAY ELSEWHERE. UNFRIENDLY CUSTOMER SERVICE POLICIES
Summary: After a business stay of 22 nights booked in a two week period (multiple rooms), the hotel refused to let us out of our prepaid stay one night early because we had finished our business. Even with over 24 hours notice before checking out! I don't know where your managers studied hospitality, but that is not the kind of service I expect. Completely unacceptable, and I will be taking all future bookings to another hotel. Cheap, tacky, inhospitable.
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback. Though we certainly do try to accommodate our guests in the best way possible. It's hard to always come to a mutual agreement. Unfortunately, you booked your stay through hotels.com and not the Hotel directly. When booked with third party companies we don't have anyway of modifying or refunding nights on your reservation because you paid hotels.com and not the Hotel directly. You agree to these terms when you make the reservation with hotels.com. Again, we do apologize for any inconvenience and we do hope you will stay with us again. Thank you for taking the time to post your review.

Summary: All I  asked during my check in that I need two separate bills for my claiming purpose. I was told to wait till evening. No one got back to me until I went back again to inform and I was told to wait until manager shows up. I couldn't get hold of manager in three days. Finally, they said we can't do it on last day.  If they can't do it I would have checked out and got another hotel for 2 days.   Worst customer service at 12792 Palm street, garden grove location Days Inn
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback. Unfortunately, we aren't able to break the receipts up into two separate bills if you stay with the hotel under one reservation. The entire reservation goes onto one folio. I did explain this to you over the phone when you asked for me to call you back, which I thought you understood and were okay with. We did provide you with the folio our system generates. I'm sorry this didn't work for you. Thank you for your stay.

Summary: Everything was fine..i have no comments just that i thought i was just a bit pricey maybe consider a a better breakfast for that price..
Manager Response: We appreciate the feedback and thank you for posting your review. We are pleased you enjoyed our location and amenities. Thank you!

Summary: stay was nice except for the sound barrier between rooms. woke me up in the middle of the night from next room loud talking and door banging.

Summary Heading: This Days Inn is clean , room was nice. The owners and...
Summary: This Days Inn is clean , room was nice. The owners and employees all very helpful and nice. This is located near many Anaheim places you would go there for. Would definitely stay there again.

Everything was pretty good. Everything was really clean. The room had everything we needed ( mifrowave, fridge, tv, etc.) overall I would recommend it to anyone. The only thing I didn't liked was that the bed was a little hard to sleep on

i was with my 2 small children and husband and we arrived pretty late at night. i was nervous choosing a hotel out of millions for our Disney weekend and now i was bervous that if i made a mistake, it was too late to recover. not only was the staff friendly, but the room was clean. We inspected for creatures and signs of poor house keeping before we settled in, and everything net our standards.

Fast check in. The front desk employee was very friendly and checked in was easy. The room was a lot bigger than I expected. Very clean. Over all this was a very nice trip and I would recommend this days Inn.
Rooms were clean. Area was quiet. breakfast is as advertised.. continental. Toast, bagel, cereal, yogurt. Don't look for anything else. Maybe a convince store pastry.

Summary Heading: Hidden gem in the Disneyland resort area
Summary: My family comes to Disneyland several times a year for a minimum 2 week vacation so we can make the most of our annual passports.  I initially found this Days Inn when I came alone with an infant. I wanted a hotel in a safe area (next door to a hospital and 5 star apt complex) an elevator, free parking, and breakfast. This hotel has everything and is clean (aside from the usual entryway rug that needs shampooing) and recently refurbished. I didn't feel like I was staying in a two star hotel.  My family has been staying at this hotel for 3 years. The staff have changed but not the quality of service. We have stayed in many other hotels which are closer to the resort. Those places are more costly, filthy, and less accommodating. Days Inn Garden Grove is nearby a Target, plenty of
We got a big room and it didn't even have a couch, tv was hard to figure it out, and the breakfast room was tiny and it didn't have variety of food
Very clean and roomy suite. The spa tub was a much welcomed amenity after a long day on our feet.

Stayed here for three nights while visiting Disneyland - rooms are big and clean! Staff are very friendly and helpful! Highly recommended! Has a washing machine/dryer on site which is handy for travelling families!

The hotel is just as advertised. The rooms are nice and big and very clean. The only thing I would have to say to improve would be the bathrooms and the towels given. Other than that it's a beautiful place to stay.

I came here cause I got a good deal on Trivago. Check in is at 2pm but I got into town a little bit earlier then expected. I called the hotel and asked if they had early check in, the receptionist said the earliest she can do is 1:30. I arrived at 1:30 and the receptionist (who was very rude) said she had no rooms available. When I come back to check in she said they need $100 deposit for the room (Trivago should have stated this or I would have not stayed). The room was really big and nice but the uptight rude owners and receptionist did. It make up for it.

I took a 5.5 hour red eye to reach Anaheim around 11:30 PM and upon my arrival was given a room that had hair in the bed, on the sheets as well as around the jacuzzi area and in the shower. I washcloth had been left on a night stand that was slightly damp and the shower wasn't even functional. This raised all sorts of questions about if the room had even been cleaned from the previous guest. Quite honestly this was the most disgusting room I've ever stayed in.  The worst part of my stay was when I called the front desk to voice my concerns and the woman working agreed that the conditions were completely unacceptable but due to a sold out hotel nothing could be done. Quite honestly if you agree that something is completely unacceptable then I don't think the appropriate response

Summary Heading: For the most part it was an ok stay, however  our room door...
Summary: For the most part it was an ok stay, however  our room door didn't work with any magnetic key, and the staff did not have the sense of urgency to fix the problem.

Summary Heading: Seemed like a normal Days Inn
Summary: There are some hit or miss reviews here but we found it just find. Our room was clean, though a close inspection revealed some areas that could use some TLC, but the bedding, bathroom, etc were all clean, and you could tell the maid service was doing their job. Carpet felt a little gunky to walk on, like it needed a deep clean, but it wasn't bad.   Breakfast was standard Days Inn bfast: juice, cereal, toast, yogurt, bananas, oatmeal. Nothing fancy, but enough to get you through your morning for sure.   All the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. We didn't need to have much contact with them though so I can't speak very much to that, but our interactions we did have were fine.   For the price we paid (very very low, on an early booking discount), it was very much

Summary Heading: Good accommodations for a great price.
Summary: I stayed here while attending a business conference. I was surprised at the size of the room for the very reasonable price. It was about twice the size of my friend's room and a third of the price (he stayed at the double tree). The bathroom was a good size and I was very pleased with my experience overall. I only really have two cons I wanted to share. The first one is that it isn't exactly in the best part of town, but don't let that deter you from staying here. And the only other thing is that their continental breakfast was pretty bare; it wasn't a very big or good selection. But it was free so I really can't complain too much.

Was at the club nearby. and needed a decent place in a jam. The Gentleman at midnight was very helpful. The room was clean, in good repair, and had a separated sitting area with couch. Not noisy either. So conveinient I stayed two additional nights.  It is directly across from "Grseat Wolf" and also about 6 restaurants within a three block radius.
After 12 hrs of Disneyland the beds were so comfy and slept really good and not a good sleeper in general ... Only downfall was parking .. Had to park outside of hotel both nights

Summary Heading: Cheap hotel that's ok to sleep in
Summary: This hotel was pretty cheap, and we got what we paid for. This hotel was not bad in any way, but it is not a nice hotel to stay at. The breakfast is very mediocre and the wifi is very weak. The beds are mediocre, however our room was quite large. If you are just looking for a mediocre hotel to stay at for a cheap price then this is a good one.

Not the closest to the beach, Disney, or even much attractions. But rooms were cleaned up well for us every single day and pretty updated in furnishings. I would stay again even if the location was a little inconvenient.

Summary Heading: Good Service, nice stay in Anaheim
Summary: The Hotel is close to Disneyland and restaurants.  Quiet area, good parking.  Very friendly and responsive staff.  Rooms are fine and to be expected for this level hotel.    I recommend this hotel if you are in this area and looking for a good place to stay.

Summary Heading: Read if you're selecting to be close to Disneyland...
Summary: This location is NOT convenient to Disney land if you do not have a car or plan to walk.  City bus might work for you - it did not for us because it was myself (single mom) and my daughter and didn't feel safe.  Hotel, staff are great!!! We had a car and just paid to park at Disney daily so it still worked great for us.  Great pool and value.
Could have had a better breakfast selection, but overall very good quality for the price.  Also, no extra blankets or pillows available inside the room, but easily accessible from front desk.

Summary Heading: You get alot for your money
Summary: This motel has it all tbh big clean room, comfy beds and clean bathroom. We was traverling on a budget and this hotel was VERY budget friendly but offers top rooms. It also provides room service which we didn't take advantage of and an outside pool which was nice and clean.

Summary Heading: The hotel was ok in quality, but the room had a musty...
Summary: The hotel was ok in quality, but the room had a musty smell. Front desk person named Alex was one of the rudest people I have come across in all my trips. She acted like she was doing a favor when asked for any information. The other staff were courteous and professional.

Over all day shift personnel was great. The Night shift lady was horrible & rude!.  About 10 pm of  July 29, 2016 I need to take medication w/ food,  had take out food earlier, but forgot spoon & fork, requested night shift desk for them, but seems she doesn't want to be bothered. Eventually, roughly went to get some and slam them at the desk, and said, we don't give them at this time. I thought there's a note in our room that says "as a courtesy, if you forget something, pls ask our desk if we have them." will never go back...

we really enjoyed our stay at this days inn and suites we were in Anaheim for 5 nights on vacation its really close to Disneyland we took the city bus since it was just in front of the hotel and saved us gas! very close to restaurants and shopping in the area. We loved how fresh and clean our room was daily Housekeeping does and outstanding Job and the nice thing was our car died and one of the ladies helped us with a jump didn't catch her name but she shows she cares about her guest Thank You will be back again

I filed a complaint with customer service. The room we were assigned to was filty and smelled really bad. the carpet was dirty and the stench smelled like a public restroom. We asked to be moved to a different room but the staff rejected our request because he said were saving that room incase there was someone looking for a room at 3am???I asked him to take a look he said after looking at it that he did not think anything was wrong with it but after he sprayed  the room with gawd knows what gave us all a headache, triggered my sisters migraine and she immediately threw up. She has never

Summary Heading: Creepy men wandering around parking lot
Summary: Pulled in to some very creepy men just standing around in the parking lot , i know it was late but that sight did not make me fill safe and then went to check in and was being charged a higher rate than on my confirmation and there was nothing he could do about it.  So had to wait around for him to call the help desk, and was on hold and that took 15 min to get an answer and then he was told, sorry I can not help you with that kind of problem wait for a manager to call you back....so still waiting in the lobby. Finally  was let into my room and then in the morning they had figured it out but not one person said a simple  sorry about that.

This is a newer built property.  Beds are pretty supportive and comfortable. The only two complaints I have are the $100 deposit (that's high compared to other Wyndham properties I've stayed at) and the automatic light switches.  Those are really annoying if someone gets up to use the restroom in the middle of the night and the place lights up brighter than the sun!

I booked thus trip months ago back in April with my corporate discount I printed my confirmation number with the room rate printed on it. When I got to the hotel to check in the manager told me that the room rate was different and would not honor what was on the confirmation page. This was completely unprofessional how could she not honor what was sent to me by email. The continental breakfast was a joke nothing was fresh other than bread for toast the rest was package pastries from the grocery store the coffee was always empty every time I went down. Also in the room the bathroom door didn't lock and was never fixed even when I told the front desk . I would not recommend this Days Inn location to anyone!

My husband and I originally planned to spend 2 nights here. We ended up only needing one night but I kind of wish we needed the room that second night. The room was really nice!  Way more than I expected from a days inn. The front desk attendant when we arrived was very nice, sweet, and helpful.

Summary Heading: Days Inn Palm Street - Garden Grove, CA
Summary: The young woman at the front desk was very friendly, knowledgeable of the surrounding area. The room was clean, in good order and up to date. The housekeepers also friendly. My only complaint was that the television lost reception and the person at the front desk assisted me in getting it back on but then I could only watch one television station (remote would not work properly) and the internet service went down for the remaining of my stay and I had to rely on my mobile device.  But as a whole great place to stay, near the Disney sites and places to eat.

We really enjoyed our stay. Close to highway. Room was Spacious. comfortable.conveniently located. Clean and spacious room. Staff helpful. We expected as described. It's close to lots of dining places..
Linens were dirty and worn! Staff was rude and lazy! They were watching Netflix on their phone at the front desk. Waited 45 min for hot water for breakfast. Had to load the jug myself.

Summary Heading: Bed was super stiff, at least for me. Saw a roach and 2...
Summary: Bed was super stiff, at least for me. Saw a roach and 2 bugs in the bathroom, shower water got slightly hot.

Broken TV, Broken A/C, Couch Cushions being used as pillows for the bed, discolored stains on the pillows, mildew smell, apathetic manager who wouldn't even make eye contact with me and argued with me and refused to refund me because we were too busy to deal with such negligence. Orbitz is a useless company and deserves to be shut down. Horrible customer service, I have never had to yell at a customer service rep before. We were lied to about getting refunded one night. Just over all a horrible experience. Pay the extra to stay else where.
This was truly a lovely stop for me and my guest . We loved the Jacuzzi, we both work and I go to school so it hit the spot .... We plan to come back again .  Thank you all !

Summary Heading: Basic, but clean. The beds and pillows were very...
Summary: Basic, but clean. The beds and pillows were very comfortable! Breakfast is a little scant - other Days Inns we've stayed at had a full breakfast so we were a little disappointed.

Hotel is not as pictured, rooms smell like mold there's trash in every corner of room, towels are stained, not just one little stain but a huge yellow stain they are also pretty thin and beat up. SUPER DISGUSTING!!!  Speaking of disgusting continental breakfast sounds nice upon check in, baloney it's just juice/milk cereal toast jelly and yogurts I lost my appetite after I noticed the juice/milk stands have a rubber band that told the lid with MOLD! It's a shame this hotel makes so much money yet not enough to replace an item their guest use....  The manager / owner SONEL [--] is a straight up snob she has NO CUSTOMER SERVICE EXPERIENCE WHAT SO EVER... For the price and deposit I expect much more. Also it's located next to a creepy beat up motel that their pool is share with

The bathroom electricity didn't work, Internet was bad always disconnected didn't like the fact that I had to give a deposit! When I have stayed at a hotel they just charge the card if anything goes wrong and they don't ask for a deposit on the spot and never had to register my car license plates! I thought that was ridiculous!
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments with TripAdvisor. I am very sorry to hear that you had a very unfortunate experience. Also, we do require a $100.00 incidental deposit from all guests. We do have a sign posted on the front desk counter when you check in explaining the policies of the deposit. It is always best to notify the staff of any issues you may have with the room so we can promptly address the situation. The purpose to as why we take car license plate information is so we know only our guests are parked in our property and avoid transients. Please know we take feedback seriously, thank you for staying with us.

Summary: We stayed 3 days at this inn.  The room was clean and the bed comfortable.  The internet was decent and the free continental breakfast was ok.  The staff was friendly and helpful.

This hotel was clean, nicely decorated, and the staff was extremely helpful.  The only complaint we had is that the credit card we used to reserve the room had expired before our check in date and some younger gentleman called us the day of our arrival and was very aggressive about cancelling our reservation because we gave a bad credit card.
Hotel is in a quiet and safe area. The rooms are clean. My only complaint is old and dirty (breaking apart) bathroom fixtures. Staff was also very courteous and friendly as well.
It's top notch facilities especially for the price,  not first visit and won't be the last, billion times better than a motel 6

Summary Heading: Great price for a weeks stay!
Summary: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a week in March. The room was just as described. Big king bed. Very comfortable. I slept like a log every night on it. Enough spaces in the parking lot for all guests. Staff was very friendly and helpful. We had a small issue with out keys not working two separate nights but the front desk took care of it right away. Excellent place for the price! I would definitely stay again and recommend!

They are very serious about 2:00PM checkout. The young man who we first saw at the reception was not entirely welcoming. We were very impressed with the size of the room - so spacious! The room was clean for our arrival. We did not hear a peep out of anyone for the 3 nights we were there. We had great sleeps!! We thought the hotel was empty until we found out it was fully booked. Couldn't believe it!  Very close to Disneyland! So if you're planning on the Disneyland days, this is perfect!  We did have lack of help from one of the reception ladies who was too lazy to help us in providing information on the best buses to be able to get to Vegas. She was not interested in helping us at all.  I would like to give a special mention to Monica, one of the lovely reception ladies

We came to CA for springbreak.  The room was clean and spacious, except the last day when both rooma we had, had bugs in it.    Front desk people were very nice.  Only real complaint we have is the lack of "breakfast" items.   Coffee was always out by 8:30am and we had to ask to make some more.  As well as the yogurt and pastries.  Besides that I gave it an average rating since we really didnt spend a significant amount of time at the hotel.

They are serious about no check in before 2:00 pm.  The hotel is about 2 miles from Disneyland, we took a taxi each day, cost between $11.00 and $14.00, before tip, not a big deal.  It's a comfortable hotel and a clean hotel.  It was a good mini vacation.
Front desk employees always very helpful and courteous. Rooms clean and never a foul smell. Laundry room a plus.
Came in town to visit Disneyland. The hotel was great for the value... Parking was a little hard to find but besides that, I have no complants. I would definitely stay there again.
Unclean bathroom with hair all around. Replace your cleaning staff already! Lots of street noise.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to bring this situation to our attention. First and foremost, i would like to apologize for any inconvenience we may have caused you. I will be bringing up these concerns with housekeeping. Housekeeping works very hard to keep up with the cleanliness of the rooms. Our goal every day is to please every guest that comes and stays. and we regret that we were not able to do so. We hope you accept our apologize and look for forward to seeing you in your next stay.

Summary Heading: A day at day Days Inn
Summary: The room was fine .I didn't like the way thet withdrew my money and I didn't like the $100.00 deposit that no one from the hotel told me about until I reached the motel.

Summary Heading: 4 days at a days Inn and Suites Annahiem
Summary: Rooms were nice at night had cockroches in the bathroom second night key did not work had to wait for someone to return to the office waited about 20 minutes bid not like the extra 100 dollers deposit and no guest.
We had to buy an air mattress for our kids because the blankets were so dirty and were grossed out by how unclean it was.
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to leave a review. I am sorry to hear your experience at the hotel was not to the level the staff here strives to provide, and we apologize your stay was unsatisfactory. The staff is available 24 hours of the day for any requests the guests may have, we would of been more than happy to provide you with clean blankets. Again, I apologize the inconvenience this may have caused you.

Summary: Our room was amazing, everything we needed and wanted. These room are LARGE! and very spacious! That was a huge plus! They have cereal, pastries, oatmeal, yogurt for breakfast! I think the thing that made this stay perfect was the hotel staff. Patricia at the front desk was MORE than friendly and helpful. This place is very very lucky to have her working here. We have loved our stay.

The hotel is okay. The room was big for 4 people. We thought our room had a funny smell, like someone threw up in this room (not a good smell..). Across the street you find a little shopping centre with a great Mexican supermarket: El Super. We bought here the best guacamole, several sweet breads (3 for $0,99!) and lots of cheap fruits. The breakfast in this hotel is super basic. Some toast and coffee/tea. There are two tables and you sit in the lobby. I had expected more.. Overall we had a good stay for one night.

The area desegnared to breakfast is so small and mixed with the office area. The first words I heard from the receptionist was this day inn branch is the best one. I've been to the other ones and I like them more than this s one

The room we were given had food stains on the floor, the refrigerator was dirty,  & hadn't been vacuumed.  The first time I called I was told the earliest they could clean the room was the next morning.  We were about to leave, when I called again, we were given another room & the front desk clerk assured me we would be compensated for the trouble.  When we went to check out, the new clerk was rude.  She called the manager on her personal cell phone, but wouldn't let me talk to the manager.  I asked if the manager could call the front desk so I could talk with her, or to please call me for discussion- I still have not heard from her.  Needless to say,no compensation was given and our second room's toilet ran all night, the shower once started wouldn't turn completely off and the

My husband and I have stayed here several times now and each stay has been pleasant.  It's a small hotel and it is quiet.  Parking is a bit tight but you can always find a spot.  The rooms are clean.  If you want to be practical and make your dollar stretch, staying here is not a bad deal.
Good clean hotel. Good service. Could have had more lighting in rooms and help re public transport

I had booked 4 rooms for 2 nights for my wedding reception. One of the guests arrived early - 6 a.m. The hotel charged an extra night for early check-in. The early arrival was due to flight issues by the airline but for the hotel to take advantage of the situation given that we had several rooms booked was pitiful. I have travelled a lot and it is a shame that what most hotels offer as a matter of good business - this days inn did not. Stay away from here...
Manager Response: Hello,  Thank you for taking the time to review our Hotel. I apologize that we were unable to meet your needs. We do appreciate and value your business. We have policies in place for early check-in fees they we have to follow. Again, thank you for your stay.

Summary Heading: The worst hotel I had never seen before
Summary: The early check in is not available. I had to do a late check in.  Attempted to arrange twos rooms, both were found extremely dirty. A lot of hairs left on pillows and bed. Found some chocolate candy on bed and floor. Obviously, the rooms had not been cleaned. Manager was rude too. He even stated that he was born and raised for hotel business. This is the last Day's Inn and Suites, and the worst hotels I have ever encountered in my life. I would like to have everyone to know, please don't consider Days Inn And Suites, in Garden Grove, California. Lamp caps were damaged. Carpet is extremely dirty. A lot of dirty stuff on walls.  What a terrible experience I had ever had.
Manager Response: Hello,   Sorry that we did not meet your expectations this time. I would have to disagree and say that our rooms are very clean and well maintained. We have been awarded many excellence awards by Wyndham for our customer service and room cleanliness.  The Manager goes out of their way to help make our guests stay as enjoyable and pleasant as possible. Of course, the situation you described do not meet our standards and were  addressed immediately, by switching you to another room. We apologize if this wasn't good enough for you.

Summary Heading: Had to put a deposit down when nowhere when I was booking...
Summary: Had to put a deposit down when nowhere when I was booking it said there had to be one. But it got resolved. Also key did not work after the first night so was a little frustrating. But very clean and close to Disney land.
We were presently surprised the rooms are very large, extremely clean, staff was nice. The price was very good
Manager Response: Hello,   Thank you for your review. We are very happy to hear you enjoyed your stay and look forward to you visiting our Hotel again very soon!

Summary Heading: nice hotel but strange odour in room
Summary: the hotel is in a great location, very quiet, the staff were great, housekeeping was great,the breakfast was insufficient, there was a strange odour coming from the air conditioning unit, i ended up getting a sinus infection while i was staying there, i cant prove the a/c unit caused it but in my opinion it did
Needed a good cheap place to stay for the weekend and found this to be a great hotel. The breakfast was pretty decent and the room was very spacious and clean. Would probably stay here again

Summary Heading: Nice room but would not stay here again
Summary: The rooms were updated and nice. The breakfast was awful. There was hardly any food and the seating area consist of two tables with four chairs. The staff was rude and unhelpful. Anytime we tried to ask a question, it seemed as though we were a terrible inconvenience. When we asked about the city bus, they gave us the wrong information.
Property is totally acceptable. Nothing special. The in room jacuzzi tub was totally rad. Pillows were hard

Great stay overall all. Breakfast was what you expects for the price. Only thing that bugs me is that this Days Inn advertise a gym in the facility, but does not have one. One of my main reason I chose the location I chose.
Quite impressive w/ the room size and cleanness of everything. The electrical equipment a little outdated but still rating this facility a 10!

Summary Heading: At first glance the room looked acceptable.  On further...
Summary: At first glance the room looked acceptable.  On further inspection, dirt and crumbs were found on the carpet.  Most noticeably in the corners.  There was a poorly installed patch of the carpet by the entry.  Ants were found in the bathroom and on the day of departure in some of our luggage.  Hairs were found in the fridge.  Hand prints were on both the bathroom and entry doors. We will never stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for posting a review and for staying with us. We would also like to apologize for some of the sub-par experiences you encountered, particularly with the condition of the bathroom and refrigerator. Kindly note that we will be sharing and discussing this with the concerned departments to ensure that the issues are addressed and rectified immediately to avoid future inconveniences to our guests.  Thank you for being our guest and I do hope we will have the opportunity of welcoming you back to our hotel in the future.

Summary: Nice hotel. Friendly staff. Clean rooms. Breakfast was just ok, but for the money it was a very good value.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback and for staying with us. We realize you have many choices when it comes to lodging, and we sincerely appreciate your business with us. We are very happy to read your positive feedback on the cleanliness of the room and the friendliness of our staff. However, I apologize for the breakfast.

Summary: This ended up being a great stay. The room is huge and very tastefully decorated and clean as i could imagine with new bedding.  Obviously newly remodeled the bathroom tile is beautiful and grout and tub spotless. Nice granite on the nightstand and bathroom also. Nice flatscreen tv. Oh and this was the best wifi of the trip so far and only one that didnt keep kicking us offline.  We saw no bugs and the ac was fine. We parked in the evening and there was plenty of parking but by morning the lot was full so i dont know if this could be a problem.  Our room was quiet, except for my loud kids. The breakfast was sparse but did have yogurt. The coffee maker in my room was broken. And the front desk hassled me about paying more for kids which was annoying. The manager straightened it

Summary Heading: Great place at a great price
Summary: Nice, clean comfortable room that was near Disney, but not so near to be in the crowds of people. Only down sides; breakfast consisted of mainly starches and the air conditioner was a bit wacky; had to set the temp real low to get the room to cool off adequately.
The room was excellent and the location was also very good! Breakfast too crowded no place to seats

The hotel was pretty clean and was a good price. Close to Disneyland and anything else you may need. The only issue was there were ants everywhere! My 2 small kids were eaten alive while sleeping in the bed! I asked the front desk to spray but it didn't make much of a difference. Even with no food in the room

I chose this hotel based solely on price. The location is not bad at all. But, from this recent experience, I was not satisfied with the service that they had to offer. There were a lot of run arounds that I didn't want to deal with so I took my business elsewhere. I wish there was more to offer.
Manager Response: Thank you for being our guest and for taking the time to write your review. We regret that we were not able to provide you with the quality of service you deserved during your recent visit with us. We also apologize for the difficulties you had experienced at check-in. Your comments are valued and noted and be rest assured that this will be shared with management to help us determine on what we could further improve on to be able to deliver a highly satisfactory experience.  Again, we thank you for your valued feedback. Despite your disappointments, we certainly hope that you would give us a chance to make your next stay with us, a better one.

Summary: I booked this room for a short Disney vacation and chose it based on price and location. The hotel was in good shape and the staff was very pleasant. It is right off of Harbor Blvd and less than 10 minutes from the Disneyland Toy Story lot. It also only a few minutes from highway 22 which will take you to 405. The breakfast wasn't very impressive but would be good for a quick bite in the morning. I had no problems connecting to the Internet and it provided sufficient speed. In my haste to get to the airport I accidentally forgot a few items on hangars and received excellent help, especially from Feras, in getting everything shipped back.

Drove to CA and stayed in DaysInn at Palm st. Went to see Korean town and did shopping, went back to hotel and sleep woke up middle of night and found cockroaches and ants killed some of them but it keeps showing up so decided to leave the place.The place is ok and quiet but woah cockroaches if you can handle that then your ok.
Manager Response: We are extremely sorry about your unsatisfactory experience. Your feedback is really appreciated so as to ensure that this type of incident does not take place again. We take pest control very seriously at our property. I will make sure that this is discussed with our pest control company. I can assure you that this must have been a isolated incident because we haven't had this brought to our attention by any other guests.

Summary: When me & my husband go to california it's due to a cruise & we always stay here. The associates are very friendly & if you need anything they are always willing to help.  On this trip the only problem that we had was the carpets were very dirty. 5 minutes into walking out of my shoes they were filthy. I understand that they can't shampoo them regular so next time I will pack my slippers
This was perfect for my recent trip to Disneyland!! The rooms are so nice and the price was amazing!!!

Overall this is a great place for quick stay, clean rooms and good customer service. Got a good deal on two rooms as well. I forgot something in the room and the next day after checking out they confirmed they have it for me and returned it. We will book here again.

I booked a room for 2 nights since I can't accommodate all my relatives visiting. The location is next to where I live. All of the receptionists were courteous and friendly, and were able to accommodate my request (I.e. Charge everything to my card including the $100 deposit, late check in without my presence, etc). The room is large though will benefit from an upgrade, and will easily fit a family with two kids, it has ample parking. My relatives didn't eat breakfast. It's basically a place for other family members to sleep and have a shower, and this met their needs. I will do it again for the same purpose.

Bes s were comfy but the smell coming from the bathroom was overwhelming. It smelled like old urine. The carpets were old and stained and we didnt want to tree amending our shoes. The breakfast was scarce and packaged foods, not fresh.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to leave a comment with your response. I am very sorry to hear about your experience at our hotel. We do our best to meet the needs of every guest, and I apologize that your stay was not to your satisfaction. We will take your comments into consideration and will use it to better our facilities and services.

Summary Heading: Met our need for a night stay close to the Angels Stadium...
Summary: Met our need for a night stay close to the Angels Stadium.  The room is clean; reception staff are very helpful and courteous.

only thing is that when you approach there is no sign at street level only up high. I could ,not find it until my husband said to turn in at Harbor Hotel. You need one we can see from Harbor. The girls at desk and reservations were great.thanks

Much nicer accomidations for less in the area. Elevator needs servicing , stairs smelled like urine and you had to pay a 100$ deposit for the room. The deposit only gets returned after they have checked the room later in the day and then took 5 days to show back up as a credit on my card. Continental breakfast was a few dollars worth of groceries laid out.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments with TripAdvisor. I am very sorry to hear that you had a very unfortunate experience. Our staff works very hard to keep up with our facilities. Our goal every day is to please every guest that comes to stay, and we regret that we were not able to do so for you. We are committed to improving not only ourselves, but the guest experience overall. We desire to have the opportunity to accommodate you in the future so that you may see these changes first hand. Also, we do require a $100.00 incidental deposit from all guests. We do have a sign posted on the front desk counter when you check in explaining the policies of the deposit and the time in which it may take to return to your account if your using a debit card. This is solely on the banks discretion and not the hotel.

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for only one night and it was perfect for our needs.  The room was nicely decorated, clean and very comfortable.  The location was central to our needs but the free parking lot was a bit small.  Having said that I did not have trouble finding a spot when needed.  My only small complaint was the complimentary breakfast was minimal, with only 2 small tables in the very small dining area.  The coffee had run out and nobody was checking it to make sure it was full.
Nice Hotel, big rooms and friendly staff. The only shortfall is that this hotel has no business center for guests. also the carpets were really dirty, needed shampooing desperately.
The rooms are clean the place is clean ... close to Disneyland .. as well as Angel Stadium .. I would recommend this place.

The room was okay. I felt it smelled like urine but my daughter and grand daughters said it smelled fine. But I bought Lysol anyways. When I undid the bed to go to sleep I found an earring in the sheets, made me feel like the linen wasn't fresh. Other than that I liked the room we were close to a lot of things we were able to see the fireworks at Disneyland (even though we had already gone) Oh and so many rooms and only one laundry room with one washer and dryer.We used it once and found a laundry mat around the corner. We didn't visit the pool. I was expecting more from the breakfast. Ate only twice our whole stay. Small parking lot we needed to share with another hotel. I kept an eye out for a free parking space close to our room lol. When one was free we'd go and move our car

Summary Heading: The room was large and clean. The people at the front desk...
Summary: The room was large and clean. The people at the front desk were very helpful. The internet kept knocking me offline.

I was in Anaheim for business. All I ever want from a hotel is for the room to be clean, comfortable, and reasonably quiet. It was all of those things. Also, I want all the basic hotel room things to work (TV, fridge, Shower, Lights, etc.). They all worked. No problems, either. I would recommend.

Was in a suite, but their definition of a suite  is a large room with a King bed, 2 night stands, dresser, TV, semi wall, a couch and coffee table. That's it. NOT worth the money. Stick with an standard room.

we stayed here during a recent trip to disneyland. it's less than 10 minutes from the parks and a straight shot to the toy story parking lot. staff was very nice, rooms were spacious and clean. breakfast was ok- just cold cereal and breads/pastries, juices and coffee. lots of places to eat nearby (mostly fast food). it's on a busy street, not far from a hospital, so we were expecting to hear traffic and sirens all night, but it was actually very quiet. i would stay here again.

Our 4 day stay at the Days Inn was very enjoyable.  The room was very clean and spacious.  The staff were very professional and helpful.  The neighborhood was quiet. We will consider returning for our next visit to Disneyland.
Cockroaches were found and after complaining to the front desk they wanted proof so our room could be changed. Also at 4 am there was a very loud fight from an unknown couple in the parking lot.

Summary Heading: The Hotel that RESENTS its guests
Summary: DON'T show up a minute before 3pm for check in..they may have your room available but it will cost you $45.. this fee includes a rude attitude and condescending responses at no additional extra charge.I AM a Wyndham Gold Rewards member, so needless to say I travel a lot, and I recommend u skip this pain in the neck

Summary Heading: Days Inn and Suites Garden Grove
Summary: The TV didn't work. I had an issue with the Internet but I was too tire to ask for help. Everything else was okay for one-night stay.

Summary Heading: My Bootcamp trip to Orange Co., CA.
Summary: My stay at the Days Inn was very plesant.  Everyone there was very nice and helpful.  I walked from there to the Hyatt down the street every morning and night I walked back.  Karen was extremely helpful the afternoon I checked in.  She is certainly an asset to that company.  Everyone else is an asset there also, I just had a chance to talk to Karen a bit more than anyone else.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for... and you're still paying too much for this dump
Summary: The front desk staff seems to hate their job.  The "pool" is tiny, filthy and shared with the motel next door.  There are bums sleeping in their cars in the parking lot.  The bathroom fan didn't work and the lights flickered the whole time.  Housekeeping is slow and if you ask for additional towels they assume you no longer need housekeeping services and skip you.  The wi-fi is non-existent.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post a review. I am very sorry to hear about the inconvenience you had with the wireless internet, your bathroom fan and unfriendly front desk.  Our pool has just been recently renovated prior to your stay with new pool tiles and furnishings, so I don't understand how this didn't meet your explications. Also, I'm unaware of bums sleeping in cars on the property but will be more aware now.  We do our best to meet the needs of every guest that stays at our Hotel and I apologize that we were not able to do so in your case.

Summary Heading: Really enjoyed the staff, service and large room.
Summary: I arrived at 2 am and was greeted by a cheerful night clerk who welcomed me with a smile and inviting words and checked me in in no time. I felt warmly  welcomed and what better way to settle into a place when you're tired and worn out after an 8 hour drive..... The room was on the highest (3rd) floor, very large, more of a suite and looked out unto a side street. It was very quiet and even had a nice view of the LA hills. It was very clean and appeared to have been renovated, everything worked as it should.  The bed was king size and very comfortable. I stayed for 4 nights for a conference at the convention center. Yes, you CAN walk to the conv center and even Disneyland from the hotel, but it is a 30 minute brisk walk each way. I loved it and considered it my daily exercise,
Helpful staff, clean room, bus stop is just steps away from the hotel & will take you right up Harbor to Conv. Center & D-Land.  Close to restaurants, Target, etc. Will stay here again!
Good safe location.   Across the street from a small mini mall.  Under 5 min drive to Disneyland. Excellent staff employees.  Clean room except for the ice bucket.
Clean property, nice rooms, comfortable beds but need more parking spaces and putting a $100 deposit on my crefit card for room damages is ridiculous!

I will not stay here again. I called before to make sure there was a pool and they said yes, but they did not say it was going to be remodeled while we were there. In fact the manager had no communication with her employees. I ask twice to speak to her and  I did not get a call back until my third day there. No one knew when was the pool going to be ready and with all this I spoke to someone else who gave us a 25% discount. It not always about the money it's a bummer when you have plans with your family and they don't work out! It's more of a bummer when no one can give you accurate information! The lack of communication says a lot.

Summary Heading: Inadequate; you get what you pay for!
Summary: If you are willing to overlook comfort and cleanliness aspects on your stay, do stay here because it is incredibly cheap. These are my gripes about this place:  1) There is only one person at the front desk manning the phones and receiving/checking in customers. As a result, when I arrived, there were several people waiting after me to check in, get their key card magnetized again, as well as someone on the phone. The clerk had to put the phone on hold for 5+ minutes while he dealt with the people physically in the lobby. Imagine if I had been unlucky and had arrived later? Or was the person on the phone trying to ask a question?   2) Upon arriving at my room, everything looked adequate upon first glance. Once I pulled back the covers however, I noticed several stains on the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our property. I am very disappointed to hear about your experience at the hotel. We are committed to providing our guests with the highest quality services and facilities. It seems that we were not able to execute an exemplary hotel stay experience with regard front office services, the unpleasant linens and towels and issues with your TV. Please accept our sincere apologies for any discomfort it may have caused you. The feedback we receive from our valued guests, like you, enables us to target problem areas. We welcome any opportunity to improve. We will discuss these concerns with our Housekeeping staff and Maintenance.

Summary Heading: We had repeated problems accessing the room. The card was...
Summary: We had repeated problems accessing the room. The card was not de-activating the door lock properly and took 20+ swipes of the card before the door was unlocked. At 10:30 PM after spending the entire day at Disneyland fighting with the door was not a pleasant undertaking. I had to make several trips to the office before the we got into our room. The next morning we were told that the lock would be checked and fixed by the time we would return that evening. Upon returning we experienced the same problem, so another trip to the office. We were told that the battery had been changed and that the code for the card was also different. After the card was recoded the lock functioned properly. The people in the office were helpful and cheerful through this all. Maybe a periodic
Manager Response: Hello, We apologize for the inconvenience you experienced with our Key Lock System. Unfortunately, with the constant daily use of the magnetic key cards they do sometimes go bad. Also, when the magnetic strip on the back of the key card comes in contact with heat or other items in your pocket or wallet they will demagnetize. Also, the locks on the door are battery operated and the batteries will run out of charge. We will do a better job of checking the locks and making sure that the batteries are charged. I'm glad we were able to fix your door lock.

Summary: I booked with Priceline. They asked me how many people in my party and I said 8. After driving for 8 hours, I arrived at the property and was informed that I had two rooms with a king bed in each. When I explained that I had booked two queen beds they were unwilling to switch me. They could clearly see that I had several children with me. The lady at the front desk said that I would have to pa an additional $69 a night to get rooms with queen beds, (my total cost for both rooms was only $500). The hotel clerk then called Priceline and put me on the phone with them. Priceline refused to pay the difference. Neither party would take responsibility and in the long run I paid $538 at the hotel because we were going to DisneyLand and I couldn't just tell my kids that we didn't have
Manager Response: Hello Alison M,  . We appreciate you taking the time to let us know about your recent stay. We encourage guests to reserve hotel rooms by calling our hotel directly so our front desk staff can personally assist them with any questions they may have and review hotel polices with you. Your reservation was booked thru Priceline for two rooms with one king bed in each room. Upon check in you informed the front desk you had a total of 9 people in your group. Our rooms with one king bed have a maximum occupancy of 2 persons, these policies are stated on our website. In order to accommodate your group size we offered you a room upgrade to 2 queens bed which comes with a upgrade charge, we discounted this charge to $50.00 plus taxes per night for each room. I'm not sure where you came up with the total charge of $538.00.  After reviewing your Folio, your total charges for two room upgrades for 5 nights each came out to $229.00 per room totaling $458.00.  I do apologize if you feel you were charged inadequately but I would like to reassure you that we did discount the rate for you and charged you fairly. Also, I apologize that Priceline didn't discuss our hotel policies with you. This is why our front desk took the time to call Priceline for you so that they could explain the situation to you. Also, I apologize that the pool wasn't heated for you. We don't advertise our pool as heated. I would like to also apologize for the internet going out and the breakfast not being to your liking. We do take our guest feedback very seriously and will do our best in improving in these areas of concern.

Summary: Really nice staff and room was nice, however, area was questionable and room was smelly. We brought in an air freshener to help the old sweaty stench and that really helped. Even though the areas was questionable and under construction my boyfriend and I walked from Disney to our room at 1am and we were just fine...we did not know bus 43 still came by around then otherwise we would have waited...only $2 per person. The hotel shares a the pool with harbor motel, and the elevators is really nice. I paid $70 a night, for that price it was a deal....I would not pay more than that. Also, there was no safe 😞Overall nice experience, microwave and fridge came in handy. Don't forget to leave a friendly tip for house keeping, really sweety ladies.
Manager Response: Hello,  Thank you for taking the time to review our property. I apologize for the unpleasant smell you had in your room. If you would have advised the front desk we could have checked the room for you and provided you with air freshener or possibly a new room. Also, I apologize the area didn't seem safe to you.However, I can reassure you that we take our guests safety very seriously and have never had any issues with previous guests. Also, thank you for complementing our housekeeping staff, I will make sure to share this with them and we look forward to you staying with us again.

Summary: I am terribly picky about cleanliness and safety, so I held my breath when I made my reservation at this property. I trusted the ratings of previous patrons and boy was I glad I did. I Highly recommend this property and would definitely choose it again and again!

We moved our reservation from Extended Stay America when they jacked up their nightly rate 80% on us because of "an event in the area". We had used them for 4 years for this very "event". We found this Days Inn 3 miles away from the event and it was bigger, cleaner and nicer than the ESA Inn for less than half the nightly rate. We will be going here from now on.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing Days Inn and Suites for your stay. We appreciate you taking note of our wonderful accommodations and posting a review. We look forward to having you stay with us again soon.

Summary Heading: Tons of space in the room making it comfortable for our...
Summary: Tons of space in the room making it comfortable for our family. However, there were strands of hair in our tub and bathroom vanity.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post a review of our Hotel. I'm glad our rooms provided a sufficient amount of space for your stay. I would like to apologize for the uncleanliness of the vanity and tub. I have discussed this with the housekeepers so that this doesn't occur again. We hope you will stay again with us soon!

Summary: The hotel is ok. However, we had the unpleasant surprise of finding bedbugs in our room! They quickly gave us another room, which was fine. But waking up in the middle of the night with bugs crawling over you is not a very good experience. The hotel manager, even though informed of this issue, was not available at the time and so far has not contacted us to propose any kind of apologies or financial compensation.
Manager Response: I want to generally apologize to your family for the issue with this most hated creature around! Unfortunately, we ran into this problem during your stay and sincerely want to let you know that we have addressed the issue. We use a National Pest control company that regularly checks our property and rooms. Unfortunately, in the Hotel industry you will come across this issue.  Again, our sincere apology to your family for this unfortunate mishap, I hope the rest of your vacation was great. However, we did reach out to you to provide a refund for your stay and didn't get a response from you. If you would like to contact me at the hotel (714) 534-3000 or by email ggdaysinn@gmail.com I will be more than happy to help you.   Thank you,  Hotel Management

Summary: I've returned annually to this Days Inn for the past several years in order to attend a major convention at the Anaheim Convention Center. While the property is by no means within walking distance, those that are cost three to four times as much per night. I'm happy to take the very frequent bus that runs along Harbor Blvd., from a bus stop a block away from the hotel.  The staff is always friendly, and my room is always clean. There's nothing lavish, but all necessary amenities are provided, so I don't need more. I did have a mini-fridge in my room this particular stay, which was nice.  The "continental breakfast" is minimal: cereal, juice, pastries, yogurt, and fruit. No hot food, but I wouldn't have expected that for the bargain room rate that I received. It was enough to get

The room was adequate, however extra blankets were not to be had the first night.  The towels were very poor quality and one had a large tangle of dark hair that had worked its way into the weave. Breakfast was lacking in choices and fresh items.

This property is a newer Days Inn in orange county and met our needs sufficiently. We were there for 6 nights to attend conference. I requested to be in quiet room and higher floor and both requests were met. The parking lot is small, but one can park at the adjacent connecting Harbor Inn lot. The wifi speed was faster than our home service. The staff were friendly. I like that the hotel has a cold/hot water dispenser. The continental breakfast offered cold cereals, danish, breads, juice drink, apple/banana. This is a no smoking hotel which is a plus to us. The only thing we wish could be better,though not possible, is when driving back to the hotel, going south on Harbor Blvd. and turning left to Palm Street where hotel is located, one could not turn left into the property and

Let me be clear: we were here for disneyland. We did not have a car and the closest bus stop was poorly lit and the bus didn't come often. So location is not ideal.   The hotel was quite nice. The room appeared to be hollow and empty but it was comfortable and clean. I left something there and it has been a nightmare to get it mailed back so I have to pick it up on my next trip. Overall, I would stay here again if I had a rental car.

The room itself was comfortable, however it lacked a desk to study or work on. I did not get a chance to use the WiFi, so I can't comment on its strength from my room. The maid service was on par, however after moving the sleeper sofa, I found food and "insect" remains. More attention to vacuuming may be needed. Apparently, pest control was adequate since no live specimens were seen during my stay (whew!). As with any hotel stay, always check your mattress bottom for bed bug stains. I did not do that, nor did I feel a need to, in this case.

The room was updated and clean, which all you really need for a Disneyland trip.  The location was weird, hard to get into the parking lot.  The breakfast was kind of weak and there are a lot of signs in the lobby that made me nervous.  Like notices that they would prosecute crimes to the fullest extent and stuff.  It made me wonder what kind of crimes are so rampant that they felt they needed this sign.  Bedding and towels weren't very good, old, worn towels and cheap bedding.  Those are two things that always make or break a hotel stay for me.

i used priceline express deal and was a bit upset at first due to distance from Disneyland. I worried for nothing. OCTA buses run on a regular schedule and were a fast, cheap way to get to the park. the room was large, clean, every spotless and new. great helpful staff, and it was across the road from a strip mall that had at least 6 restaurants and a grocery store among other things. a 10 minute walk to Target as well. I was very pleased, and I would stay here again in a heart beat.

There was NO outdoor pool as advertised. We were not made aware of a fitness center anywhere. No public computers for use. Breakfast was a dried donut, some Tang orange juice, and a banana that was very ripe. Bed was okay, pillows real small. Showers okay, had to clean the air filter of the A/C unit by ourselves. I will not recommend this Days Inn to anyone.
Huge rooms, lots of space to move around. Close enough to Disney but still quiet. I will definitely stay here again. Very clean rooms and staff was helpful and nice.

We only stayed here for one night, as Disneyland was a small part of a larger trip. However, both my hubby and I as well as my folks who were traveling with us were very pleased with the rooms we received. Both of the rooms were very large and clean. We didn't notice any smells or housekeeping issues at all. The woman at the check in desk was polite and pleasant.  It is quite a ways from Disneyland, so I wouldn't recommend it if you're planning on walking to and from the park. However, we had a car and drove to the Disney parking lot and used the shuttle from there. I know that's not for everyone (there is a $17 per day fee for parking), but it was the most convenient for us.  Overall, we booked this hotel online and got what we felt was good value for the price we paid. The per

We had stayed at the Garden Grove Inn Suites two times before and we came back because it was a really nice hotel close to everything.  This time however we noticed that the place needs some sprucing up.  I remember the first time I noticed that the carpet looked and smelled fresh.  Now it looks like they are old and they didn't have that fresh smell anymore, we kept our socks on.  The tile in the bathroom needs replacing and the towel hook on the door was upside down so the towels slide right off.
We had ants all over both rooms that we had. My daughters was worse & she had ands all over her in bed.

Summary Heading: Still a great place to stay!
Summary: This was my second visit this year.  I was on the third floor in March and loved it.   This time I ended up on the 2nd floor... I could hear the folks upstairs stomping around till 2:00 am....  And the folks in the next room one night of my stay talking till the wee hours of the night.  I called the front desk  and I they kindly asked them to be quieter.   My only complaint is that the room had a slight mildew-like smell when the AC was running.  Thankfully I could open the windows and get fresh air in.    It's still a great place to stay.  I love that it's still on Harbor, but not as chaotic as the hotels in Anaheim.  The rooms open up to face a smaller  quiet motel and residential neighborhood.   Across Harbor is a strip mall convenient with Pharmacy and some great fast (but

Summary Heading: Great location, but customer service lackef
Summary: We arrived for our check in after a particularly hot Saturday morning after a wedding ceremony. We chose the this nun as opposed to other big chains because we like to support small business.   Pros: The room was clean, and decor was simple and modern. Recent upgrades were noticeable and appreciated.   Cons:  The front desk girl was really looking forward to the end if her shift and gave us all kinda of unfriendly attitude. It wasn't anything specific just in the lack of her charm- if you work in the front I expect a smile and a greeting- you work in an air conditioned office!!!! And the AC was a wall unit that felt cool to the touch but didn't get the room cold at all- and this past weekend we really needed it.   Other than that is say  give it a try, hopefully a different girl
My stay was very comfortable and enjoyable.  The hotel staff was warm and friendly.  They accommodated my needs very well.  I will plan on staying there again when I come back in town.

Summary Heading: Room is clean and quite. Air is working good, but breakfast...
Summary: Room is clean and quite. Air is working good, but breakfast is not quite good especially coffee no taste at all.
Cfound myself in need of a room after modnight.  The staff was friendly and had me in a room in 15 minutes.
The hotel and the people were very nice.  The room had extremely poor lighting. The light in the bathroom did not work and they could not fix it.

Summary Heading: Not worth the money we paid.
Summary: Booked this hotel at a pretty awesome rate for our four day visit to Disneyland. Figured it didn't have to be anything special since all we did was sleep there.  First problem was, despite calling ahead to confirm, they would not let us have a roll away bed in our room. The room had two queen beds and easily room for another queen bed and yet they said it was too small to add a roll away bed. But they had no trouble charging me extra for the 5th person in my room- they just wouldn't provide a bed for her.  Second, I did NOT feel safe leaving my car parked in the lot for the night. The hotel is next to a motel, which is in a residential neighborhood. It is off the beaten path (which makes it a quiet hotel- I will give them that) but I was pretty shocked each morning when my car
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback about your recent stay with us. We apologize to hear that there were some housekeeping concerns. Hopefully these were reported to the Front Desk during your stay, as we have a very talented staff that is able to remedy such concerns as they arise. We understand your concerns of having your vehicle parked in our lot however, I  can assure you that we have a very safe property and have never had any issues with guests vehicles. We understand your frustration over the rates and policies but unfortunately the hotel has no control over third party booking rates and policies. In the future, we hope you will book through us directly, and we will be happy to meet or beat the best available rate and go over the hotel policies with you! Please contact us when planning your next vacation, and we will be happy to assist with booking the best deal possible! We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: 1. The pool does not belong to them but the motel next door.  2. Manager/owner on purpose was never avaliable she told me to get a refund to contact priceline knowing she had to authorize it on her end. Never happened. She yelled at me and hung up. 3. No internet no tv  4. Says 2.3 miles from Disney it's 4.6 miles 5. Air conditioner in room didn't work 6. Maid refused towels for the pool 7. Sheet/comforter old worn and full of holes from ware.
Manager Response: Your comments are extremely valuable, and we thank you for taking the time to share about your experience. We apologize that the room was not up to our routinely superior standard of cleanliness. Our housekeeping department is usually commended for their thorough service, with special attention to detail. I'm not sure why you said there was no TV or internet when all our rooms have both. Also, I'm not sure where you got your directions to Disneyland from but if you put our property address in Google maps it will tell you we are exactly 2.5 miles from Disneyland Park and that is what we advertise. Also, I do recall speaking with you on the phone and trying to assist you with your concerns however, given the intensity of the conversation I chose to end the phone call. Please know that your experience was not typical. Again, thank you for your stay with us.

Summary: The parking area needed to be cleaned more often. The pool is not visible from the hotel. Make sure you ask where it is. Nice stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing about your recent stay at our hotel. It seems that you had an overall enjoyable experience, and we hope that your vacation was a memorable one! We apologize the parking lot wasn't as clean as you anticipate. We will make sure to discuss this with our staff. We would love the opportunity to welcome you back on a future stay! Thank you.

Summary Heading: Staff was very nice. We had a corner room which was big and...
Summary: Staff was very nice. We had a corner room which was big and quiet. The breakfast in the morning could be a little better.
The hotel was great overall the disadvantage is they don't have shuttle service to Disney but we managed and the rooms were very large and had plenty of room for my infant to crawl around in.

Driving up to the hotel, the location felt dodgy and unsafe.  After checking into the room, we opened the door only to be hit with a musty stench that can only be associated with mold and old, unkempt buildings.  The beds were so hard that sleeping on the floor would have been more comfortable.  Additionally, the sheets and towels had holes, black spots, and hairs.    Eventually, the smell caused me to have breathing problems in the middle of the night.  Upon further investigation, we found mold in the air conditioning unit and were forced to ask for another room.  Unfortunately, the only room available was in the motel next door.  After this downgrade and a sleepless night, we were transferred to a new room the next day.  However, the new room had the same problems.  We
