Decent value for the price, very nice front desk folks.  If you're planning on working out:  No A/C or water in the fitness center (the day I stayed it was in the 90s outdoors) .  Also no weights/weight machines, just a treadmill and an elliptical.  Had to call the front desk and have them open it up every time I wanted to use it.  Appliances in the room were hit and miss.  A/C in the room took about 2 hours to actually cool the room.

It's been a two days since we checked out of 3 rooms we payed for. I can finally sit, breath and write to you about our sad stay. (Days Inn Anaheim) My first impression was Antonio (one of the front desk men) telling a couple, then an older man to be quiet when they were asking him questions. He would talk so fast and cut them off. He did it to me too, which turned me to paying over 500$ again for one of our rooms which was payed for in Feb earlier this year on priceline. We noticed this charge when we were about to get on a ride at Disneyland. I called right away and spoke to Antonio. He told me he would call me back, he didn't. I called again and he said he would call me back, and after 6 pm he still didn't call back. We called Chase bank and they took care of it. I called the
Manager Response: We appreciate that you took the time to provide feedback about your recent stay with us. It is unfortunate to hear that the hotel fell short of your expectations. I'm unclear of the charges you are speaking of. We don't double charge our guests. We do require a $100.00 incidental hold on a credit card and sometimes we have found that if a debit card is used for this authorization an additional amount of funds might be held by the bank or credit card company. We do have signage at the front desk explaining all these policies to the guest. I apologize if Antonio was not polite to you. I will make sure to address these concerns with Antonio. I'm unaware of the mold and toilet problems you had. If anytime guests have any maintenance issues we do our best in resolving them immediately. I can assure we don't have any mold at our property. Again, we are sorry to hear that your stay was not satisfactory, and we hope that you will allow us another opportunity to serve you in the future!

Summary: This was our first stay at this hotel. We would definately stay here again. Staff was friendly and professional. Room was clean and comfortable. The value was worth the price paid.
Economical rate, friendly manner, clean room w/ refrigerator and microwave, free breakfast, quiet, and excellent location, we enjoyed staying this hotel very much.

Before booking this hotel I read all the reviews available.  Most reviews were good and the price was nice, so we booked hoping the bad reviews were incorrect.  I was wrong!  Note to self: DON'T be cheap, spend a few extra dollars per day to get a clean, safe hotel with a healthy continental breakfast. Firstly the staff was nice, but the rooms were terrible.  Access to rooms are outside (which normally wouldn't bother me) except the bolt on our room door was missing.  I would have switched rooms but we had a 3rd floor room and I liked we were on the top floor (especially with kids). Bathroom was out-dated with some mold and water damage (sometimes bugs found crawling in tub). Carpet was old and stained. Hotel somewhat close drive to Disneyland, but access to Hotel from main road

Summary Heading: Everything was good, but towels are a little old and...
Summary: Everything was good, but towels are a little old and gritty. There's humidity specially in the bathroom.

The room has musty smell. I smelled it as soon as I opened the door. The carpet was dirty and old. When I was going to take a shower and spread the shower curtain, the smell was funky. Although the check-in was pretty fast and the room was pretty big for a two queen bedroom.

I booked one night here through Hotwire, unfortunately my wife made a mistake and put 2 adults but we had are two children with us and they booked us in a room with a king bed. Should not have been problem right. I tried to talk to the front desk and explain what happened and they would not give us a room with two queens without an upgrade charge. I have stayed in a lot of hotels and have never had to pay extra to go from one king to two queens or vice versa. Not only that, the person at the front desk didn't have a clue what that would be. After calling the manager I was told it would cost an extra $60.00 which was within 20.00 of what I payed for the room to begin with. So then I asked what it would cost for a rollin bed and of course they had to call the manager because no
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our Hotel. I apologize we did not meet your expectations. Our Hotel policy for a Standard King room occupancy is 3 people.  Due to the fact you exceeded that occupancy we offered you our room type with two Queen beds. However, that room type does have a different cost to it which is noted online when you book the room. Also, we do charge for children 12 and above. We also do charge $15.00 plus tax for the roll away bed. At anytime if your unsure of your reservation with whomever you booked it with you are more than welcome to call the hotel directly and have these questions answered prior to arrival. I apologize the front desk was unable to answer all your questions in a timely manner, I will make sure to discuss that with our staff. We hope you will give our Hotel another chance if you are in the area.

Summary: I enjoyed my stay at the Days Inn and Suites. The Hotel Hostess Bernice was amazing, she was extremely friendly and helped me checked into my room hassle free. I will definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family and I plan on booking rooms here again in the future.

The hotel staff was very nice and extremely helpful. The room was clean and everything worked fine. I did not know that this was an outside corridor hotel or else I would not have booked it. Our second night we were awakened at 4:00am by loud banging on the room door next to us and then an argument inside the room. The hotel walls are paper thin. After a while we finally got up packed and checked out.

What a refreshing surprise when we checked into the Days Inn in Anaheim. Very efficient staff at the front desk, helpful with information, but the biggest surprise was the room.  Completely redone room, very comfortable beds with nice linens, spacious room.  This was near a very busy street and I worried about noise, but the rooms were quiet, very little noise even from neighbors doors closing.  Would definitely stay here again when in the area.  Short drive up the main road to Disney, and quite a few neighboring places to eat.

A nice place to stay at when my girlfriend and I had an overnight stay in Garden Grove. The rooms were very large and accommodating. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable on the area. I know it was close to Disneyland and the Crystal Cathedral(which I did not know is going through a two year renovation). Over all experience was a positive. I would stay here again.

I thought this was a pretty good place. The room was pretty spacious and clean. The bed wasn't the best but what do you expect at a 2 star hotel. The breakfast was pretty weak like other reviewers mentioned. It was more like a snack. But free is free. I thought the staff was friendly. I'd stay here again

Summary Heading: Few places to stay for a reasonable price
Summary: I'm so glad we stayed here. The property was much better than expected. Many hotels in the LA area are dated, but this one not only seemed quite updated, but it was so reasonably priced. I have stayed once before, but due to lack of sleep, don't remember it.

Summary Heading: I had a good visit, and the price was good. It was a...
Summary: I had a good visit, and the price was good. It was a Valentines Day gift to my girlfriend, so I wanted a hot tub suite. And while the hot tub experience was nice, one of the jets was too strong and created a few problems for us. Overall, I enjoyed my stay, but it wasn't the type of unbelievable experience that would make me long to return.

We were so disappointed  we always stay at Marietta  we stayed here because all our family did.  None of would ever stay at a days inn property again. Ever. That can't be called breakfast.  Service was rude.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our Hotel. I apologize you did not enjoy your stay. We have made substantially changes to our Continental Breakfast based on customer reviews and brand standards. We hope you will give our Hotel another chance if you are in the area visiting your family. Thanks again.

Summary: We had a horrible experience at this hotel and will never return. They even deactivated our room keys one night over a "billing issue." They wanted more money because they claimed our teenage children were adults and wanted to charge us more after we already prepaid for the room in advance and notified them of our kids ages at the time of the reservation. The hotel was also poorly maintained, stank of cigarettes and beds we're hard as rocks and the towels were like sandpaper. If we didn't have other extended family staying at the hotel we would have left and found a better hotel. Pay a few dollars more and go somewhere else or you'll regret it.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our Hotel. I apologize that your keys were deactivated. Unfortunately, there are many reasons this can happen due to the magnetic strip on the key card. However, we do not deactivate room keys of guests that are in house. Also, our hotel policy is that we do charge for children 12 and older. I apologize if your room smelled of cigarettes. We are a 100% non-smoking hotel but unfortunately some customers don't care for the policy. We do our best to eliminate any residual odors in the room once the guest has checked out. Also, I apologize the bed and towels weren't to your comfort. We will take these points into consideration. Thanks again.

Summary: This hotel was very clean and the rooms were very spacious. Staff, especially David, was very helpful and friendly. The rooms appear to have been recently updated and were nice. The pillows were great and there is a variety of firmness which was appreciated. Shower had nice water pressure and the towels were big and soft. However, the beds, which I think are new, were pretty firm and my back was sore after 2 night in them. Also the breakfast was really lacking. There was oatmeal, cereal, and Danishes. The "hot" water in the lobby was barely lukewarm and wouldn't cook the oatmeal so we had to take it back to our room and heat it in the microwave. The pool is shared with another hotel which is inconvenient and not heated. Even though the rooms were great, next time we visit

I have stayed at several places along Harbor Boulevard when visiting Disneyland, and this has been my favorite.  Certainly got the most bang for my vacation dollar! The rooms are pretty new and very clean, and the beds are very comfortable!   Everyone from David at the front desk to the housekeeping staff were courteous and helped make my stay most enjoyable.   I will definitely stay here on my next visit to SoCal!

This was the first time I have stayed at this property but have passed by it many times in the past.  Check-in and check-out were quick and efficient with friendly staff.  I was reminded that it is strictly a non-smoking hotel and that I was allowed no visitors.  I had to sign a credit card charge of $100 as a deposit in case I violated the smoking and visitor ban.  It is supposed to be automatically reversed after checkout but I have not yet reviewed my credit card statement.  Accidents happen.  The room was pleasantly furnished although simple.  The bed was comfortable although the pillows were somewhat lumpy.   The clothes hangers were metal and not removable at all from the supporting bar.  It made it very difficult to hang anything larger than a tie because of the narrow

I will NEVER stay at this hotel again! We booked a two night stay with them on a popular online hotel website. Later we added one night to the beginning of the trip and pre-paid in advance for everything. Upon arriving we found the room to be ridiculously disappointing. The toilet was dirty, the room stank of cigarette smoke, the workmanship of repairs in the room could only have been done by a child or a seriously inebriated individual. Disneyland was the focus of our trip not the hotel so we figured we would survive the little time we would be there. The next morning we found "breakfast" to be little more than a few pieces of bruised fruit so plan to buy breakfast elsewhere. After a long day at Disneyland we returned to the hotel and our room keys didn't work. We went to the

I keep coming back to this hotel as is one of my favorites in the Anaheim area. Hotel is clean, pretty quiet, hotel amenities are great plus they always provide great value price. As my other reviews, everything is in good working condition. The hotel added TWC HD programming to their TVs , nice touch if you are staying in the room while resting.   I must say David in the front desk always offers exceptional customer services and was able to satisfy my requests during my stay. Thanks!

We had stayed at another property in the area/around the block, on a prior trip. This hotel was better. It was our first time at a Days Inn. We had an end/corner unit - the room and bathroom was spacious. Could even see Disneyland fireworks from our 3rd floor window. Everything was great! The street noise on one side of the bldg might bother some people - but it was ok and less noticeable with the AC on. Only suggestion is to improve the breakfast offering. It was a small counter. But at least was nice to have something :) Thanks and Aloha!

Went to Disneyland, not to far away nice and quiet, beds were comfortable. Didn't have that soggy smell hotels often have. The people at the front desk were nice even though I had a late check in. The only thing I would say is our room had a hike about the size of a quarter where the lock hit up against it. Other than that was pleasant stay.

The Hotel was a little disappointing.   The PRO: It was very Clean, Convenient to dining choices, Free parking, Friendly staff, complimentary breakfast, good coffee in lobby   The CON :    I could not get the wi-fi to work, the coffee pot would not work correctly  and leaked all over the desk, I was not happy to see cigarette holes in the blanket and several holes in the shade of the pole lamp.  But then I also have to realize that you get what you pay for and the price was one half  of the other hotels.
Clean, spacious! !  I didn't expect it to be clean,  but it was spotless.. Will definitely come back!  Great service!!

Summary Heading: Great Place to stay and its safe
Summary: I make a reservation at this location about every 2 years. I make it 1 year in advance due to the hotel being safe and clean. David the front desk clerk was great. The room was clean and the area was very quite. We will see you again. Thanks for keeping a great hotel
Manager Response: Thank you so much for being a return guest, I am very happy to hear that you and your family had such a great time with us and that our staff was very helpful and polite.  Thank you again for being our guest and we look forward to seeing you and your family again on your next trip to the Garden Grove area.

Summary: Pretty much expect to pay for bad customer service. The rooms are okay, like any other hotel so go somewhere else. If you have a problem too bad, because they don't take responsibility. Don't recommend. You've been warned.  The guy in the front Antonio should attend some customer service seminars.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for being our guest and taking the time to write a review about your experiences. I am very sorry to hear that your stay with us did not meet your expectations. While I can fully understand your disappointment, I would like to assure you that your experiences were not typical. I am truly sorry for the impression you had of our hotel and the experience you had with Antonio.   Everything we do is aimed at providing our guests with an excellent hotel experience and your feedback is extremely valuable. We truly appreciate you sharing your thoughts with us so that we may continue to deliver exceptional service in the future.

Summary Heading: Lied to but still forced to pay!!!
Summary: I booked this hotel for 3 days for a business trip my brother and I had planned but I had called to make sure that this hotel had the suite door access in a hallway and not to the outdoors like a parking lot. I was assured over the phone by an employee at this location that this was a hallway access style hotel and not to worry. We had some highly valuable items with us that we felt safer keeping in that style of room so I needed the peace of mind.  When we arrived I went directly to the front desk, where I was "greeted' by a young man who had no interest in his job. I know people will say, yeah that job sucks and how would you like that crappy, low paying job but hey, when I was young, I had to do crappy work that was allot more labor intensive than that but I would smile and
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We take our guest comments very seriously and always strive to provide comfortable and friendly accommodations. We’re sorry about the miscommunication about our hotel being a exterior corridor hotel.  We do have pictures of our hotel on the Days Inn website showing that we are a exterior corridor hotel. Also, according to our cancellation policy you were charged the first night for the room and reimbursed the remainder two nights. Again, we do apologize for the inconvenience you experienced. However, I do hope you will give our property another chance.

Summary Heading: Value and proximity...what else do you need while at Disney?
Summary: I see these negative reviews about this hotel and I don't get it.  What did they expect for what they paid.....the Waldorf Astoria?  This is a value hotel.  Look, if you're going to spend every waking minute at Disneyland for a couple of days like we did, this hotel is perfect and the price is right.  This hotel is very close to Disneyland, is very inexpensive, is relatively clean, and has a basic breakfast.    We stayed for three nights in July while we took our twin 6 year old boys to Disneyland on our way to San Diego.  It was perfect.  We got up early in the morning, went to the park, came back in the afternoon for an hour nap, then returned to the park until 10:00 pm.----and turned around and did a 2nd day of the same thing and then we were gone.  We basically slept in the

I made my reservation for my trip to Anaheim over a week in advance through the Days Inn 1-800 number. I received a room quote for a queen size bed and expected that when I arrived . When I arrived I got a king sized bed at $10 more. It was not a nicer room, as my friend had the queen room which was much bigger. The office would not honor my quote and neither would the manager. My friend asked for two rooms of equal size and got one with a full size bed at no better value.  There was no breakfast or coffee at 8:00 in the morning when they advertise that it lasts until 9:00. None of us will stay here again

The stay I had here was quite pleasant. The rooms were in very good order and everything was functional and clean. We got a good deal on the rooms as well. The beds were comfortable and the air conditioning/heater kicked on quickly without any qualms. What stood out to me most was how amazing the staff was. The guy with short hair was great to work with(I forgot to get his name) as he was courteous and professional and we had some friendly conversation. The beautiful young girl at the front desk whose name was Beatrice I believe, was extremely accommodating, friendly, personable and went out of her way to help us pretty much on the daily. After she made us fresh coffee, we had some nice conversation with her while she printed out mapped directions of locations in the area that
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the kind review. I am very lucky to have a staff full of great people like Berenice working at this hotel. Our staff genuinely cares about our guest's experience and we will always go out of our way to ensure that every guest has a great memorable stay. We appreciate your comments and look forward to having you stay with us again soon!

Summary: Great customer service and even helped us with a little bit of an early check in! Rooms were large and spacious. Very clean and close to everything! Only suggestion would be to get a higher floor, sounded like elephants were on top of us all night. Also, TV didn't work.... the cable box wasn't set up?

room clean, check in easy, not much noise. Disappointed in the roughness of the towels. Over priced. expecte the $69/ night rate but it was elevated! hide a bed very weak, hard and difficult to sleep on. Got a baby crib but no sheet/ Good sized room. Nicer than most Days Inn and Suites.  No pool
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are happy you enjoyed your stay and apologize for the unclean carpet behind the night stand and bed. I will make sure to discuss this with the housekeepers. We look forward to having you stay with us again.

Summary Heading: pleasant first stay at Days Inn
Summary: room was clean, except that the carpet needed to be cleaned behind the bed  and night stand. The room was very large and well appointed
Very near Disneyland, quiet, very affordable, huge room and bathroom, nice decor, continental breakfast, free parking, microwave, and fridge.  Would stay here again.

Summary Heading: The location and spaces of this hotel are good, but the...
Summary: The location and spaces of this hotel are good, but the odor/cleanliness is an issue. They need to fix the issue.

The inn is hugely overrated. The room I had a broken lamp and chair was all worn down. The remote was NOT working and the staff had to come in a couple of times which was quite a hassle. The manager, instead of apology, complained and yelled at me that I complain too much and then trying to give more inconvenience to our family!! The manager is the rudest one I have ever seen in my travel history over 20 years. One of the staff member seems to be nice although the other one was rude-- I think the staff takes that attitude toward the customer because of the manager. The breakfast was a joke ( the worst out of any Days Inn I've been)--don't consider there is a breakfast. I am planning to contact the Customer relations of Days Inn chain--This is the worst Days Inn I've ever been.
Manager Response: We apologize you were not satisfied with your stay. We did our best in responding and resolving any issues you  May have had. We replaced your lamp and remote control immediately  When you reported it to the Frontdesk. Again, thank you for your stay.

Summary Heading: Nice stay for a couple days
Summary: Nice, clean hotel. Stayed for 3 days. Got upgraded to a larger room for free. Was able to sleep in without being bothered by hotel staff or other guests. Convenient to local attractions and shops.

Summary Heading: Good value for the money.  The room was impressive and the...
Summary: Good value for the money.  The room was impressive and the staff helpful.  This was a quiet location even though close to main streets and close to Disneyland.

We weren't there but one night.  We got in late and had to check in at the night window.  The room was clean, and the bed was comfortable.  One of the bedside lamps did not work, but I had to unplug it anyway to accommodate a personal device, so it really did not matter.  We got in late an left early so we didn't bother with the TV.  AC was a little tricky to get started but I figured it out.  Getting to it is a little tricky since if you approach from Harbor Blvd you can't make a left turn off of Palm into the parking lot.  Best approach is to come from Garden Grove Blvd and turn north on Palm. We didn't try the breakfast since it looked like all carbs no protein.

I stayed here for a night. I stayed on the top floor, which was clean and quiet. The room face a busy road, however, I didn't notice any noise. The front desk personnel weren't too bad, however, should have been more friendly. The rate wasn't too bad.

felt stuck to stay at hotel due to them not being able to offer me my reservation which was a Jacuzzi room because I had kids so then I said I will get a regular room but paid same price because I could not cancel reservation according to front desk.

Summary Heading: My boyfriend and I spent 2 nights at this hotel and we...
Summary: My boyfriend and I spent 2 nights at this hotel and we enjoyed our stay here. The only complaints we had were the paper thin walls...we could hear the family in the room next to us. All their conversations, the kid's tantrums she threw, the parents yelling at her, etc. And the only other complaint was that there was a power outage in the middle of the night. We had to use the lights from our phones to light the way to the bathroom. Other than those two things, we have no other complaints. The staff at the front desk were nice, friendly. The beds were comfy, rooms well kept. The breakfast they offered was something quick to take on the go. Overall, it was a pleasant stay and we plan on booking our future trips here.
This is the second time we have stayed at this location. Rooms are nice and clean. Close to Disneyland as well.

my boyfriend, sister and I stayed here in august while we visited Disneyland. The prices of hotels and motels close to Disneyland are all overpriced for what you get, noisy, unclean and unfriendly the complete opposite of this hotel. My boyfriend and I stayed in room 316 and my sister in 216. The rooms were large even with a king bed and the bathrooms are clean and functional. The carpets were clean and the TV was a large flat screen with premium channels! The staff was also wonderful, I did not get his name but a young man helped my boyfriend very late at night when our toilet clogged. He came up and plunged as well as acquired a snake and was very sweet and helpful laughing and joking with my boyfriend. The price was perfect we stayed 7 nights for less then 5 nights anywhere
The staff were very friendly and helpful.  The room was very nice and clean.  Close to main attractions in Anaheim at a very affordable price.

There is no business center at this location!! Website clearly states there is one...but there is NOT. Location is good, if you can figure out how to turn in off the street without doing a U-turn, location/access. Beds where like a brick. I have stayed at Days Inn's before, this was the worst one.

Summary Heading: Days inn Things to Consider before Booking A Room
Summary: Days Inn convenient location fair price.Beyond that not good in regards to being clean and comfortable.Bathrooms are not sanitary at all tub was filthy tiles and toilet seat was dingy and dirty.I've seen cleaner restrooms at rest stops.To the manager who reads these reviews  and hides in meetings to avoid dissatisfied Vistors you should really give a tutorial on how to lose business FAST.I get that it's expensive for any major overhauls to improve your hotel but bleach  and a mop are cheap.Tell your house keeping to make nice with the vacuum .Also it would also be wise to professionally steam clean your carpets.Your hotel has so much potential REAP it by cleaning IT!!!!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to write a review. I am truly sorry that your stay with us was not up to your standards. I do apologize for being in meetings. However, we did offer you multiple room options which you were not satisfied with. We do value our guests and I apologize if this was not up to your expectations. I do hope you would give us a chance to make it right and look forward to seeing you in the future.  Sincerely,   General Manager

Summary: Definitely will stay here again ! Very clean and quiet ! Staff was friendly and the rooms were clean. Towels were ruff, would be my only complaint. I highly recommend this hotel and will stay here again
Manager Response: Dear Melgizzle,  Thank you for your feedback. We take our guest comments very seriously and always strive to provide comfortable and friendly accommodations. We appreciate your nice comment regarding our staff and cleanliness. We will take into consideration replacing the towels.  Sincerely,   General Manager

Summary Heading: Stayed here at Days Inn last year and the place was fine...
Summary: Stayed here at Days Inn last year and the place was fine. No problems of anything. Stayed here this year and the place went downhill. The room was that clean. Stains on the walls, bath room had hair on the counter when we just arrived. Booger on the bathroom wall. Basically not worth staying here. Pay a little more and go somewhere else.
Manager Response: Dear Clint W,  First of all, thank you very much for your recent stay at our hotel and returning to our hotel for another stay.; I am so sorry to see you did not enjoy your overall experience with us.  We make sure to have our carpets steam cleaned weekly and that the rooms are kept clean daily. We hope to have the honor of serving you again should your travels bring you back to Garden Grove, CA.  Sincerely, General Manager

Summary: We stayed here for a few days for a wedding. We came in a big group but I have to say when we got home we came back with an extra passenger. I found one big cockroach in my makeup bag! which I had set in the bathroom. I know it was from there because we have no roaches. Needless to say I would think twice before coming back. The location was good. Not to far from disney but what to do bout the pests?

Summary Heading: for $72.00 it was ok.  Breakfast was nothing so we ate out...
Summary: for $72.00 it was ok.  Breakfast was nothing so we ate out.  Towels were small and ruff, bed pillows weren't comfortable.  It's an old hotel, internet was on and off.  Staff was nice, room was clean.  If you don't mind spending extra to go out for breakfast and just want a budget room to sleep in, then this would be ok.  I would rather spend a little more money and have a nicer hotel.

Summary Heading: Good Location!! Need a little Updating!!
Summary: I was just in California June30th thru July 8th..  I must say, the Hotel is located in a great spot, there is a plaza right across the street with a Super-Market; Pharmacy, Bank, Pizzaria and other stores, its close to the freeways, we did a lot of traveling.  Its about 10 min away from Disney Land which was ok, but now I know there are a lot more hotels closer but I guess for the price it was just perfect.  The up side of the room, it was cleaned everyday, fresh towels everyday the beds and pillows were wonderfully comfortable.  They have very selected breakfast, danishes, cold cereal, coffee and juice.  I guess it ok to start your day but you need a hot breakfast eventually or a heavy lunch.  In my specific room, not sure about the others, the bathroom was a little "icky" the

Summary Heading: Everything is in good order , except the carpet needs to be...
Summary: Everything is in good order , except the carpet needs to be shampoo cleaned , there are a lot of stained spots by the bathroom .
Manager Response: Dear Michael P,  First of all, thank you very much for your recent stay at our hotel. I am so sorry to see you did not enjoy your overall experience with us. We do have a service come in and steam clean our carpets weekly. I will make sure to stress to them to do a more thorough job. We look forward to your next stay with us.   Sincerely, General Manager

Summary: The bed and the room were clean but the service was bad.  The employee named Antonio was so rude and he wasn't friendly at all.  He has such a bad attitude when I asked him for some cups.  He said we don't have any cups and what kind of hotel that didn't have any cups.   I paid over $100 for the room and they didn't have any cup.  I was so mad that I wanted to leave that night.  I wouldn't stay at this hotel ever again.
This great location, facilities OK.  Bathroom was nasty, shower curtain/bathroom reeked of pee was replaced.

At the rate they quoted us compared to the other hotels/motels in the area, I expected a run down motel with old mattresses, old carpeting and so forth. When we arrived, we were pleasantly surprised to find that it was in a nice neighborhood, had elevators to help us get up to the 3rd floor, the rooms are so spacious we could have placed another queen bed in ours for a total of 3 beds and still have had plenty of space to walk around. The mattresses seemed brand new, plush, a little firm, but still comfortable. The carpet was clean and in great condition, the bathroom was also so spacious they could have easily placed a jacuzzi in the corner. Every night we could look out our window and see the firework show from Disneyland. Although they do not have a business center, we saved

This hotel is very clean and in a fairly quiet spot. I enjoyed being close to so many restaraunnts.   Antonio at the front desk was awesome ... very courteous and helpful, went out of his way to give us directions and information about the area….  will be back for sure!

The facilities at the hotel are great. Nice clean rooms which are cleaned daily. Bathrooms are clean and tidy. Very comfy beds. I spent 6 nights at this hotel and had no issues at all. Heaps better than other hotels I've stayed at. The location is excellent. Close walk to Disneyland and bus stops are right next to the hotel. Staff are very professional and helpful. Berenice in particular is very friendly and helpful. Very welcoming and excellent service.  I had an awesome time staying at this hotel and would definately recommend this hotel to anyone travelling alone or with friends and family.

I was pleased with the overall accomodations.  the bed was comfy, the room was clean and tidy.  I liked the continental breakfast....it was just right.  I also was very happy with the in room free wifi.   thank you for a great weekend get away.

WOW! Ok first off I went here to spend a wonderful night. It was very clean and the bathroom had good supply of towels and was very welcoming. The check process was very quick and professional. David is very professional and helps the customers. The room i got was a king suite with hot tub. I had an awesome time and felt very relaxed. I would definitely come back here again in the future for conferences or a vacation.

If your looking to go to Disney this days inn is a great place to stay. Recently I went to disneyland and was on a tight budget. This was a great find. Not only was it comfortable, quite, and clean. The staff is really nice. Only downside is you cant walk to the park, it was about 5 min in car from the park but I must say it was worth it. Defiantly more of a place just to sleep, since there is no pool.

I was surprised when I walked into the room at how large it was.  The bed was comfortable, the shower was good, and the room was clean.  The front desk staff were so friendly and helpful -- especially David.  He was there when I checked in late Friday night, Saturday morning and Sunday morning.
For the price this was a nice hotel and is in a good location for getting from one location to another in Orange Co.  Close to Disneyland but not too close for the traffic.

Decided to return back to this hotel because of the area and its close to work. Stayed for an entire week and was happy. Room was clean a bit worn down, I stayed in better ones at this hotel. Microwave and fridge working. (Fridge was a little noise at night). Excellent bed and shower.

Great location! Has everything near! The price is great, specially because is near the convention center. Has restaurants, fast foods, pharmacies, banks and a hospital near! Room was clean and comfortable! Nice staff.

Summary Heading: In general the Hotel is good for short stays or overniht...
Summary: In general the Hotel is good for short stays or overniht. Have a very good location and the rate is reasonable for the facilities. I will stay again.

We live over an hour away from Disneyland, and I needed a room for one night. This place is perfect for that type of stay. I checked in very late and left very early, so I didn't really have any interacation with the staff. They were polite, but quite frankly I didn't feel like talking when I checked in or out. The room was clean. I can't tell you whether the bed was comfortable or not. I was so tired from Disneyland that it didn't matter. I will say that the room we were in (201) has an airleak in the window seal and the whistling of the air didn't let my husband sleep well. The bathroom was clean as well. Their towels feel like you are drying off with sandpaper. I would bring my own next time. The food was descent. I'd rather spend money at a drive through. I stayed here
the hotel was average.  We live in Las Vegas so it's hard to compare.  It was clean and 2 miles from Disney so it served the purpose .  The breakfast is only Danishes.

This was a excellent hotel and stay, the rooms were very clean and were a lot more updated then other people's reviews say. We actually arrived 1 day early from Everett, WA and they said that they didn't have the room I wanted available until the  following day, and the manager actually upgraded me to a suite for the price I was paying for the other room, which are also a great value for what your getting. The beds were very comfortable, staff was very nice every time I went into office for free breakfast or to ask a question. I stayed here for 7 days and have 0 complaints at all. Also very close to Disneyland but not in too busy of area which was great as well. Will definitely stay hear again and recommend it to everyone in the future.

The price, room, staff, location was all perfect.  This hotel is a true gem.  We enjoyed our stay and when we are back in town, this is where we will be staying.  The only thing I did not care for were the bathroom towels....they need upgrading.  Thank you Days Inn for a great stay at your hotel.

I had a impromptu family vacation over spring break, to Disneyland. So I was looking for an affordable hotel/motel to stay in that wouldn’t break the bank. Since it was Spring break all of the properties in the area were a little on the high price side.  The Days Inn and suites was one of the more reasonable priced accommodations.  I stayed there with my wife and 2 children.  From a motel stand point (this place is a motel, the room doors are open to the outside, not an interior hallway) it was clean. That is one of the most important factors to me when traveling with my family. The place has to be clean and the Days Inn was clean.  As for room comfort, the beds were ok, soft enough but nothing to wright home about. The blankets were a bit thin (in April it’s still a bit chilly
The staff made it easy to book a room same day for a business trip.  My only complaint is that it's fairly difficult to get into due to some construction and somewhat poor parking lot planning.

This is such a great place.  While all the surrounding  Disneyland hotel areas are old and run down, this location is fresh and new.  The non smoking facility is the best feature.  The prices could be a little lowere there but overall a most excellent place to stay.

I was there for five nights,  stay was good. I then went to the Days Inn in Redwood City, CA. and it was really BAD.  I was there six nights and the TV remote did not work on the small TV, Breakfast was sub standard and every thing was old and poorly cared for. Really made me appricate your Hotel.

Great place I would say to have the doors on the hotel shut more gently because every time someone open and shut a door around me it woke me up. I would also say to have the staff in front more friendly every time I went down to the front desk it felt like I was bothering them

Summary Heading: Huge room only a short drive from Disneyland!
Summary: This Days Inn was very quiet and very clean. Parking was easy and close to the rooms! Our room was a King room and it was HUGE! Breakfast leaves something to be desired with fruit and limited cereal and milk and juice. We have had a lot better breakfasts at similar hotels closer to Disneyland but for the price we paid ($60/night) I don't hold it to a high standard for continental breakfast. The rooms were cleaned daily and overall nothing negative to say about the rooms. It is about 2 miles south of DIsneyland right where Harbor bends (a slight turn onto Palm, HOwever it is a little tough to get into the hotel until you figure it out. It was an overall nice 5 night stay for myself and my husband! Thanks Days Inn for accomodating our 10 year anniversary trip!
I was here in 3/2010, room was nice and clean.  Just came back 3/2013, room is old so does blanket; it has holds.  These need to be replaced.
Need a greater variety  of breakfast selection. Like that it was close to the conference I attented.

Summary Heading: Love this hotel it is so clean and beds are comfortable...
Summary: Love this hotel it is so clean and beds are comfortable, location is great close to disneyland. will go back anytime and recommend to anyone anytime!

We looked for a cheap, clean, quiet hotel close to disneyland, and that is just we got.   I went off of proir reviews and hoped it would be true, it was all good.  We saves tons of cash! Our room was small but perfect for crashing after disneyland.  Down side was water pressure was lacking so it took forever to wash my long hair.  The towels are small and rough, bed was comfy, but the pillows a bit lumpy. For the rate we paid, no big deal, a quiet, clean, safe, cheap place overrode these issues.  The breakfast was minimal but the oatmeal,  fruit and packaged pastries plus juice/coffee was enough for us.  We also used the convenient Toy Story lot with  busses to the main gate drop off for a quick trip with little walking.  The hotel area seems safe, and when there was no parking

Used a Wyndham based discount for an amazing rate, so the value was high.  The service was very good, not many opportunities to display excellence above and beyond normal service.  Rooms were clean and simple, the only issue was the HDTV had basic cable; was expecting movie availability.  Sleep quality was good with a quiet location and minimal drive by traffic.  At the same time the location had an awkward one-way street entry/exit issues so difficult to enter the facility more than one round-the-block way.  Since there' not alot to be done about the street, this note is just a advisement for potential guests: don't trust your map if says "Turn Left into hotel". ....and yes, I'd definitely stay there again with the coupon.

Summary Heading: Always stay here when possible. We stay every year around...
Summary: Always stay here when possible. We stay every year around Christmas and a later date in the spring. There was a late party upstairs this year - not normal. Good secure parking and close to everything.

Summary Heading: Nice decor, but overpriced for mediocracy
Summary: Positive: the rooms are very large and the decor is tastefully done, and the staff is friendly.  However, the closet is tiny and you can't get to it when the bathroom door is open. We had to leave things lying around in that fancy space when they could have left more closet room. Negative: The refrigerator's freezer section was half filled with ice, while the fridge was dripping water everywhere and not cold. There was a dial to control the temperature but you couldn't see any arrow to tell where the dial was set. I asked the staff to fix or replace the fridge, but they didn't. The second night I had to defrost it myself and figure out the temp setting by patiently listening to the motor. Also disappointing was that there is no jacuzzi, no pool, and only two exercise machines.

Summary Heading: This hotel is newly renovated and maintained quite nicely...
Summary: This hotel is newly renovated and maintained quite nicely. It's only a 10 minute drive from Disneyland and the Honda Center. The staff is friendly and polite. I highly recommend staying here. Great value.

the pillows were not comfortable at all and the mattress didnt help. however, i cant say that i would never stay at this hotel again b/c close to everything, very quiet, nice staff, clean room. overall, the stay was enjoyable.  this didnt not fit in the problem section: note: its not necessarily a problem, but there was a sticky ring clearly from a cup on one of the nightstands. this was there when we entered the room for the first night of our stay. we thought it was just one of those rings that was not easy to get rid of, but on our last night, my husband wiped it away with just a washcloth and water. while this was less than minor, it seemed kind of careless that a bright red sticky ring was overlooked for at least 3 days.

So my boyfriend and I made the short trip out to Orange County from LA to have a mini vacation of sorts for Valentines Day weekend! We wanted a room the was reasonable with a jacuzzi tub and boy did we get it! The room was spacious clean and nice! The jacuzzi tub was awesome and the hotel location was close enough to many restaurants, attractions, and stores. The guy that checked us in was great and the hotel was extremely quiet ( except for our last night our neighbor was playing loud music that clearly traveled through the thin walls). I'll definitely be back ! I'm weary about ground level rooms, but this one changed my mind!

Every member of the front desk staff I spoke with was exceptionally polite and helpful. In particular, the young woman working the daytime weekday shifts was always friendly and engaging. However, I only mention her because I dealt with her more than anyone else. Everyone was fantastic.   My only complaints: the internet was a little finicky and the breakfast wasn't great. Other than that, a very satisfying experience.

Summary Heading: Stayed in the King Suite. The room was clean, quiet and...
Summary: Stayed in the King Suite. The room was clean, quiet and comfortable. Good size with nice TV and wi if access. Juice and fruit  in the lobby in the mornings was decent for a quick something to get you out the door. I'd stay here in a similar room again.

Summary Heading: Can't beat it for the price
Summary: We stayed at the Days Inn in January.  It was very convenient for us as we were visiting family near by.  Parking was good and felt very safe.  The room was spacious and clean.  The staff was pleasant and helpful.  It had a refrigerator and microwave, and a flat screen TV.  I go to this area a lot as I have family nearby and will be staying here again on my next visit.  The breakfast had coffee, juice, rolls, some fruit, and cereal.  If the breakfast had been a little more choice I would have given the property 5 stars.  It is not fancy but a good solid value.

Summary Heading: Nice place - reasonably priced for the area - close to Disney Land
Summary: We stayed for two nights. The first room was on an upper floor and was in very clean condition, but the lock was broken and the key wouldn't work. They expected to be able to get it fixed but were unable to. We had to be let in by someone each time but then moved to a first floor room for the second night. This room was worn a bit and the light near the bed didn't work. They did come and replace it quickly. The pool is located at an adjoining motel - they share it and additional parking is available there too which is good because the lot is very small! The pool is a good size! You can only go one way when it comes to the road to enter and exit the parking lot.  Disney Land is a short drive away. There are plenty of fast food places, restaurants and shopping in the area of the

Summary Heading: Best Value for Your Money Near Disney Land
Summary: Prior to our trip to the Disney area, my decision to go with this Days Inn relied heavily on price and the consumer reviews I read on TripAdvisor.com.  Traveling as much as I do, I understand that every review is going to have those negative remarks due to those people who are expecting a lot more than they're paying for, thus their needs are not met like they thought they would be.  I'm here to tell you, I wasn't expecting much paying roughly $65 per night (plus tax) for a week during the holidays - we checked in Dec. 27th and checked out Jan. 3, 2013 - but my expectations were more than exceeded during my stay.  There were a total of 9 people in our group utilizing 4 rooms in this hotel and everyone of us was more than pleased with the service and value we received.  I won't

My wife and I stayed were very pleased with our stay at this hotel. The parking is complimentary and it's next to Disneyland. If you have transportation, you'll have absolutely no problem getting around the area. Our room was clean and we liked the fact that it was quiet. Also, everyone complaining about the $100.00 incidental charges in which, the hotel does to protect itself as well as keep the "riff raff" out is standard within the hotel industry. Especially when you're in a resort, tourist atmosphere, so "we get it". We'll return in 2013.
Manager Response: We appreciate your comments and glad that you enjoyed your visit. We look forward to your next stay with us!

Summary: Pretty impressed about the hotel. Everything was clean, quiet and everything worked. It has a fridge and microwave, both were clean and in working condition. I'm definitely coming back and staying here.
Manager Response: We are very glad you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for the review.

Summary: Great hotel.  Will come back for sure.  Front desk staff was friendly and knowledgable.  Easy check in.  The room was really nice and clean.

The hotel served its purpose & nothing more. The check in girl was great. It gave a comfortable bed to sleep in, as that was all we were there for. The rooms were clean, but definately numerous signs of wear & tear, but for the price we paid we really couldn't complain. The breakfast, if that's what you want to call it was a joke! We ended up picking up food @ the store & utilizing the fridge & micro.

This hotel is well located just south Of Anaheim and north of the 22 highway. It was easy to get everywhere I needed to be the three days I stayed there.   The rooms are large and comfortable. The carpeting bedding and draperies seemed a step above average.  The lighting in the room was good and the amenities such as a microwave, fridge etc were all in good working order and clean.  The hotel was very clean and I appreciated that.  The only complaint I would say is the AC does not seem quite sufficient to cool the room. While I was there the weather was extra hot and muggy.  Due to the size of the room and the extra high ceiling (which I liked)  the standard wall mounted under window ac had a hard time keeping the room at a perfect temp. It was not bad but I noticed it. Also,

This hotel is conveniently located near Disneyland but not walking distance. It's away from the busyness of the parks so its quiet at night. The parking lot is small, but its free. The shower rod was broken so the shower curtain would slide to the middle. The carpet was kind of dirty.. The beds were clean and very comfortable. BEWARE: they will charge your credit card $100 for "incidentals" and then credit it when you check out!
The room was just fine, I was told that the breakfast  was simple, it was. so what! I did'nt  come for the breakfast. I came for the room and it was just fine. Dan
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind review. We look forward to your next stay with us.

Summary: The room was nice and had quite a bit of space, however the bathroom leaves something to be desired.  The tile was damaged, scarred, making it appear dirty.  There was quite a bit of rust on the metal door jams, water damage to the lower part of the wall near the tub, and the shower insert/wall was separating from the wall.

The hotel is quiet and the bed was comfortable. Will stay again. I appreciate the set up of the location as it creates a more private atmosphere. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance. Thank you for a great experience.
the hotel was nice and got an upgrade which was nice, the kids up stairs were running around most of the night.

There were ants in our room in several locations.  After coming home from Disneyland late at night our key no longer worked in the room and there was nobody at the front desk to help us get into our room.   We had to find another place to use the restroom.  When we got back to the hotel someone was able to help us.  The rooms were pretty quiet and it was in a good location and all other service was friendly.

My family stayed here for 6 nights this past summer. The rooms were clean and very spacious. The staff was very friendly and very accommodating. The ladies that cleaned our room everyday went the extra mile to make my son's crib as well and set up his stuffed animals just the way he likes them! Close to the highway and Disneyland. Such a deal! I would recommend this hotel to anyone I know!

Summary Heading: Smells like someone peed all over the floor
Summary: This hotel is in a pretty bad neighborhood. If you are going to disneyland dont stay here. Its far!!! Its definitely OUTSIDE of the nice area disney is in. The beds are HARD as rock and there is an odor that will not go away. It smells like someone peed all over the floor. Its awful. They are crazy when you check in too. We said it was for 2 people but my mom was there with us and the front desk lady had to question her... Are you staying in the room as well? My goodness. It was the 3rd degree. She was just dropping us off ok?! Then she told us we are NOT allowed to have any visitors. What kind of place is this? Im in the room as I write this. The smell is just so nauseating. Just wish we could leave and get our money back. Its an awful stay. The water pressure is a small
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your stay at our hotel. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and we’re very sorry you were unhappy with our guest rooms and our service. We will take your comments under consideration as we continually work to improve our guest experience. We hope you will consider staying with us in the future.

Summary: We spent 3 nights here at the beginning of April. The room was clean and looked like it had been recently remodeled. The furniture wasn't the highest quality, but it looked new. We had a king bed room and  the bed was comfortable. The bathroom was a pretty good size as was the room itself. There was a desk/chair and flat screen TV. Our room also had a small refrig and microwave. We didn't try the continental breakfast, so I can't comment on that. We were on the 2nd floor at the far end away from the office and had no issues with noise from below or above. Parking wasn't an issue either.   The motel is on Harbor south of Disneyland. It is not within walking distance. It is just beyond the edge of what is considered the “resort area” and I don't believe ART even comes down that

The Hotel and staff are very nice.  Our room was spacious, clean and modern.  The price was fair.  However, Harbor Blvd is right there and it is a very fast, busy, and loud street.  They share a pool with the neighboring motel - it is NOT heated.  There is no Jacuzzi unless you book one with your room.  The free continental breakfast is NOT great and they need more than 2 tables in the eating area.  This hotel has NO shuttle.  We took the city bus # 43.  We reccommend buying a day pass for $4.00 per person.  There are few places to eat near this hotel.
Hotel was a great find and was super clean. Cont. breakfast was ok. Location was great not to far from Disneyland but far enough from all the crowds.  Would definately stay again.

This is not only the best Day’s Inn I’ve ever stayed in, it’s a tie for the best under-$75 (senior rate) room I’ve ever discovered.  (I suspect the highly negative reviews here are either bogus, or confused this one with another Days Inn on Harbor up in Anaheim.)  The room was spacious, high-ceilinged, tastefully decorated, with excellent furnishings, including very comfy bed and excellent adjustable office chair.  Internet, breakfast, and micro-fridge all just fine.  Only quibble was that in-room coffeemaker needed cleaning or replacement, as coffee from it was undrinkable. (That’s from prior guests using wretched Orange County tap water rather than bottled water.)  Fortunately, coffee from breakfast area was okay.

It looks newly renovated. Our room was clean and odorless which was great. The beds were very comfy. Had a flat screen tv as well.   The location was good for Disneyland and the price was $75 a night. Which I think was a good deal for how clean it was.   We were on the first floor so The only thing I didn't like was hearing people walking upstairs. Sounded like they were stomping. You could hear people talk as well. So we turned up the air to filter the sound out.   We will be coming back to stay at this hotel.
Would not stay there again. The rug was filthy. The bathroom had a disgusting/nauseating odor that would not go away. I wanted checked out the minute I saw my room!

Was a bit skeptical because of the price ($70) but booked it anyway because it was recently renovated and I was staying just one night. This place was really clean and quiet. It also has a mini fridge and microwave for a midnight snack. I used to stay at another hotel down the road but they charged $110 without the fridge or microwave.

The room that we got is the 1 King Bed Non Smoking Suite. It is new, clean, modern, efficient, easy and simple. Very roomy and the bed is AWESOME! The room also has a flat screen television, microwave, fridge and coffee maker. They also have free breakfast. Also, I love the location very convenient.  Only reason why I didn't rate this hotel higher is because the housekeepers did not clean our room, I really did not mind it but my boyfriend was pretty upset about it. We were gonna call the front desk about it but we got back to our room late at night and we were pretty tired. Also there is no pool. Other than that, I definitely recommend this hotel.

Our room was large and comfortable - great beds.  The housekeeping was excellent; everything was very clean; bed linens changed daily.  There was a microwave, refrigerator and flat screen television, none of which we used.  There is a guest laundry which we did use - very convenient.  The management was very quick to provide us with extra hangers and towels and to replace a burned out lightbulb.  The room only had one chair and one luggage rack.  We never received the extra chair we requested.  Parking is limited, so if you get in late you may have to park a little way away from your room.  Breakfast is basic.  Many restaurants are closeby.   The hotel is on a main road but we did not hear road noises.  Landscaping is attractive.  I would stay here again; we had an excellent

Summary Heading: The room rate was a real deal... too bad the hookers thought so also
Summary: First of all, I want to say read nrhflyer's review that he posted on Oct 13, 2009 titled “Very Good and Very Disappointing”.  His review is spot on of this hotel.  I especially agree with his wi-fi experience.  I was only able to connect to the wi-fi on our netbook for a few minutes before it would lose connection but I was able to log on fine using my ipod touch.  I would also want to mention that if you have sensitive skin, the towels were extremely rough.  I'm not that sensitive but it felt like I was drying off with sandpaper.  Now for the rooms itself, they look exactly as they do in the website photos so I didn't feel I needed to post any additional ones.  The only thing you don't see in the photos is that this hotel actually has an elevator.    We were there 2 nights and
Manager Response: Hello,   Thank you for choosing to stay at the Days Inn and Suites in Garden Grove, CA. I'm glad to hear you enjoyed your stay and our staff. We strive to bring excellent service to our guests. We hope to see you again very soon.  Thank You,  Management

Summary: We stayed in the jacuzzi suite(room 109) for 2 nights and it was wonderful!!!! I have stayed at many hotels in the Disney area this hotel room was the nicest room we have stayed in! Other hotels might have better facilities and options but this ROOM was NICE!!! The jacuzzi was so luxurious. The only things that were inconvient was that breakfast was lacking in options, the bed is typical in comfort(not plush like we prefer) and the distance from Disney but it was really no big deal. But if you stay in the jacuzzi room it makes up in romance for what it lacks in other areas.

Our stay was a mixture of very good service, and great disappointment.  I'll start with the positives.  By far the best thing about this Days Inn is the staff.  They were very friendly and helpful, taking care of any need promptly and offering advice and directions to local attractions.  Upon arrival, I mentioned I had children with me and they put us on the 3rd floor facing Disneyland so we could see the evening fireworks from our room. This is a new Days Inn, approx 1 year old, so everything is fresh and new.  The rooms are nice even if they are fairly basic.  Each is equipped with a flat panel TV with cable, a mini fridge, mini microwave, coffee pot and a small table with 2 chairs.  No DVD or other extras.  Our mini fridge wasn't working so I informed the front desk.  They

Summary Heading: Double charged us & denied it!!! Beware of this hotel!!!
Summary: We booked thru Hotels.com about 2 weeks before we stayed here.  We checked in and they didn't have our reservation!  We showed the confirmation and they took our card and claimed it was for incidentals.  We saw a "hold" on our card for $133.34!!!  They denied they charged our card!  We went down there in person and they manager on duty said that the hold would be released!  He admitted it!!!  Then we called the next day and we spoke SONELL and she claimed that NO ONE authorized our card!  What a nightmare!!!  The floors are filthy (our feet were black, we had to wear our socks the whole time) and the place is just old.  The towels are really thin and hard so you have to bring your own!  This place claims to have breakfast...I mean I guess if you like cold costco packaged
Manager Response: Hello,   I apologize for the Inconvenience during your stay. Our first priority is our customer service to our guests and I assure you that we try to deal with any issues guests may have in a honest and timely manner. Again, I apologize for any miscommunication there may have been. We hope you chnage your mind about staying with us again.   Thanks Again, Management

Summary Heading: I am very picky And I was Extremly Happy
Summary: Customer service great, for the price it was better than any $200-$280 price range we were looking at, so we had extra spending money, close to everything. I would stay there again. Room is like brand new, and the bed was so comfortable I did not want to get out, refrigerator, mircowave, iron, hair dyer all in room, flat screen tv. And free muffins, fruit or cereal for breakfast. Only complaint in doors are heavy and neighbors had kids who kept going in and out so door slammed and woke me up earlier than I wanted to get up.

I arrived at 3:30 in the morning and asked for a room for three days. The clerk said I had to pay full price for thae arrival even though it was an extremely late check in. I paid any way. The next morning, I went at the last minute to the breakfast. There was nothing left and the would not put more out. I asked for maid service and was told that since I was just there for a short time maid service was not called for. I paid a full rate, yet was denied service. The romm was nice but the service was terrible. I was quoted one rate but had to pay a higher rate on check out. The manager said I was quoted the wrong rate. I would not stay here again.

This has to be one of the nicest hotels we ever stayed at.  By far the best Days Inn we ever encountered.  Nice, clean, large rooms. Neatly decorated. I thought I was at the Hilton. Refrigerator and microwave. Comfortable beds.  And that flat screen TV with lots of channels was fantastic. We were on a trip to Disneyland and were very happy to come to a nice comfortable place after a long day.  This establishment is either new or recently remodeled  because everything is neat and clean inside and out.  The elevator really comes in handy, too. It is located a mile or so down Harbor blvd. near restaurants, supermarkets, banks, and other businesses.  Traffic noise was not a problem.  Area is not run down like some parts in Buena Park or Cypress.  We will definitely stay here again.

Summary: My wife decided we needed to go on a road trip to Disneyland. So I charged up the DVD players & off we went. After 7.5 hours in the car with a 5 & 6 year old I needed to find a hotel. All the hotels around Disneyland were booked. So we kept looking around & stumbled onto this new Days Inn at Garden Grove. The receptionist were very nice. The rooms were very reasonable. Very tastefully decorated with wall mounted LCD & cable. We stayed two nights & were very comfortable. They had complimentary continental breakfast.
